docs.text: Title 1 - Crimes Against the Person 1(01) First Degree Murder A person commits First Degree Murder when they. a) Intentionally and deliberately kill another human with malice aforethought i) This must also be premeditated, meaning the offender planned to kill the victim prior to incident ; or b) Kill another human while commuting any one (or more) of the following regardless of intent, premeditated malice aforethought: i) **** Arson ii) Robbery iii) Burglary iv) Kidnapping v) Torture vi) Sexual Battery vii) Rape Anyone in violation is guilty under this section of code. A violation of 1(01) ‌is‌ ‌a‌ **** Felony 60 months 1(02). Second Degree Murder A person commits Second Degree Murder when they. a) Kill another human malice afterthought but without premeditation; or b) Kill another human but did so while in quarrel or in heat of passion. **** i) Note the name-calling, smirking, “ Dirty looks” and/or general taunting alone do not qualify a quarrel and aren’t sufficient enough to justify a “heat of passion” argument. Anyone in violation is guilty under this section of code. A violation of 1(02) ‌is‌ ‌a‌ Felony 55 months 1(03). Manslaughter A person commits Manslaughter when they. a) Commits crime or act with gross negligence and those actions caused another person’s death Anyone in violation is guilty under this section of code. A violation of 1(03) ‌is‌ ‌a‌ Felony 30 months 1(04). Attempted Murder A person commits Attempted Murder when they. a) Intended to kill another human and took a direct step towards doing so. I) Intended to kill another human and took a direct step towards doing so. ;or II) Unintentionally took a direct step that resulted in attempt on another human’s life Anyone in violation is guilty under this section of code. A violation of 1(04)A is a Felony 28 months 1(05). Criminal Threats A person commits Criminal Threats when they. a) Communicate to another that they will physically harm a person and put said person in a reasonable amount of fear for their own safety b) Communicate to another that they will physically harm or kill another person’s immediate family ;or c) Threaten to kill or harm law enforcement or government employees. Anyone in violation is guilty under this section of code. A violation of 1(05) is a wobbler. Therefore, depending on severity of the crime it can be a Misdemeanor 10 months 1(06). Harassment via Electronic Communication Device A person commits Harassment via Electronic Communication Device when they. a) Use an electronic communication device to make threats another person ;or b) Repeatedly use electronic communication devices to harass another person. This includes repeatedly using obscene language with the internet to offend another person. Anyone in violation is guilty under section of code. A violation of 1(06) ‌is‌ ‌a‌ Misdemeanor 6 months 1(07). Indirect Electronic Harassment A person commits Indirect Electronic Harassment when they. a) Use an electronic communication device to send personal identifying Information or a message of harassing nature with the intent of causing unwanted physical contact, injury, or harassment upon the victim. Anyone in violation is guilty under section of code. A violation of 1(07) ‌is‌ ‌a‌ Misdemeanor 4 months 1(08). Assault A person commits Assault when they. **** a) Willfully completed an act that was likely to result in the use of force against someone else. Anyone in violation is guilty under section of code. A violation of 1(08) ‌is‌ ‌a‌ Misdemeanor {!!! danger "6 months" 1(09). Battery A person commits Battery when they * a) * Use intentional and unlawful force or violence to cause physical harm to another person Anyone in violation is guilty under section of code. A violation of 1(09) ‌is‌ ‌a‌ Misdemeanor 6 months 1(10). Assault with a Deadly Weapon A person commits Assault with a Deadly Weapon when they. a) Commits 1(08). Assault and use of weapons that can cause great bodily injury or death. A violation of 1(10) is a Felony 24 months 1(11). Stalking A person commits Staking when they **** a) Commits 1(05). Criminal Threats; is and b) Intentionally or maliciously follows or another person A violation of 1(11) is a Misdemeanor 4 months 1(12). False Imprisonment A person commits False Imprisonment when they a) Commits 1(08). Assault and use of weapons that can cause great bodily injury or death. A violation of 1(12) is a Felony 8 months 1(13). Kidnapping A person commits Kidnapping they. a) Move another person without that person’s consent by using force or fear I) To “move another person” for purpose of this section is defined as any one of these things: **** 1) Method - When the victim is transported in a motor vehicle. **** 2) Concealment - When moving the victim decreases the likelihood of being caught. **** 3) Risk of harm - When moving the victim for the purpose of facilitating another crime or when you increase the perceived risk. (i.e. moving someone from a public place into a private one.) A violation of 1(13) is a Felony 28 months 1(14). Torture A person commits Torture when they. a) Intentionally causes extreme physical or psychological pain and suffering for someone for the purpose of revenge, extortion, persuasion, or for any sadistic purpose. A violation of 1(14) is a Felony 40 months 1(15). Human Trafficking A person commits Human Trafficking when they. a) Intentionally smuggle non-citizen into the state whiteout proper visa and authorization ;or b) Intentionally restrict another person’s liberty with the intent of forced labor, or forced activities. A violation of 1(15) is a Felony 40 months

‌or‌ ‌people‌ ‌for‌ ‌hire‌ ‌or‌ ‌any‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌with‌ ‌a‌ ‌minimum‌ ‌gross‌ ‌weight‌ ‌of‌ ‌26,001‌lbs‌ ‌(11793kg)‌ ‌These‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌are‌ ‌referred‌ ‌to‌ ‌as‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌motor‌ ‌vehicles.‌ ‌\ b) All‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌which‌ ‌must‌ ‌comply‌ ‌with‌ ‌all‌ ‌sections‌ ‌of‌ ‌Title‌ ‌8.‌ ‌ ‌\ c) Codes‌ ‌in‌ ‌this‌ ‌title‌ ‌may‌ ‌only‌ ‌be‌ ‌enforced‌ ‌by‌ ‌certified‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌inspectors.‌ ‌\ i) This‌ ‌code‌ ‌is‌ ‌enforced‌ ‌by‌ ‌the‌ ‌Los‌ ‌Santos‌ ‌Police‌ ‌Departments‌ ‌CVE‌ ‌Division,‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas‌ ‌Highway‌ ‌Patrols‌ ‌CVE ‌and‌ ‌the‌ ‌Blaine‌ ‌County‌ ‌Cargo‌ ‌Manifest/Bill‌ ‌of‌ ‌Lading‌ ‌(for‌ ‌cargo‌ ‌carrying‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌only)‌\ \ A violation of 10(02). is an Infraction $150 10(03).‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Motor‌ ‌Vehicle‌ ‌Point‌ ‌System‌ No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌they‌ ‌are‌ ‌listed‌ ‌below‌ ‌\ 1) No/Inaccurate‌ ‌cargo‌ ‌manifest‌ ‌-‌ ‌5‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\Over‌ ‌hour‌ ‌logbook‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌falsification‌ ‌of‌ ‌logs‌ ‌-‌ ‌10‌ ‌Points‌ ‌and‌ ‌a‌ ‌fine‌ ‌of‌ ‌$1000‌ ‌\ iii) Violations‌ ‌of‌ ‌Section‌ ‌8(19\ 1) 1-9‌ ‌MPH‌ ‌over‌ ‌the‌ ‌limit‌ ‌-‌ ‌1‌ ‌Point‌ ‌\ 2) 10-14‌ ‌MPH‌ ‌over‌ ‌the‌ ‌limit‌ ‌-‌ ‌2‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 3) 15-19‌ ‌MPH‌ ‌over‌ ‌the‌ ‌limit‌ ‌-‌ ‌3‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 4) 20-24‌ ‌MPH‌ ‌over‌ ‌the‌ ‌limit‌ ‌-‌ ‌4‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 5) 24+‌ ‌over‌ ‌the‌ ‌limit‌ ‌-‌ ‌5‌ ‌Points‌\ iv) Violations‌ ‌of‌ ‌Section‌ ‌8(15)‌ ‌-‌ ‌4‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ v) Violations‌ ‌of‌ ‌Section‌ ‌8(22)‌ ‌-‌ ‌6‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ c) If‌ ‌the‌ ‌violation‌ ‌puts‌ ‌the‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌out‌ ‌of‌ ‌service‌ ‌all‌ ‌violations‌ ‌from‌ ‌that‌ ‌incident‌ ‌shall‌ ‌be‌ ‌doubled‌ \ d) If‌ ‌a‌ ‌person‌ ‌obtains‌ ‌70‌ ‌points‌ ‌within‌ ‌15‌ ‌days‌ ‌his‌ ‌or‌ ‌her‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌driver's‌ ‌license‌ ‌shall‌ ‌be‌ ‌suspended‌ ‌\ i) After‌ ‌the‌ ‌suspension‌ ‌the‌ ‌amount‌ ‌of‌ ‌points‌ ‌on‌ ‌the‌ ‌license‌ ‌shall‌ ‌be‌ ‌reduced‌ ‌by‌ ‌15.‌ ‌\ e) If‌ ‌a‌ ‌person‌ ‌obtains‌ ‌3‌ ‌violations‌ ‌marked‌ ‌with‌ ‌^‌ ‌symbol‌ ‌above‌ ‌or‌ ‌listed‌ ‌below‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌15‌ ‌day‌ ‌period‌ ‌their‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Drivers‌ ‌License‌ ‌shall‌ ‌be‌ ‌suspended.‌\ \ A violation of 10(03). is an Infraction ‌ ‌ $200 10(04).‌ ‌Duty‌ ‌Day‌ ‌Limits‌ No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌Shall,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌a‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌‌motor‌ ‌vehicle‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌complying‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌duty‌ ‌day‌ ‌stipulations‌\ i) CDL‌ ‌Driver’s‌ ‌is‌ ‌only‌ ‌allowed‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌on‌ ‌duty‌ ‌for‌ ‌no‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌14‌ ‌hours‌ ‌per‌ ‌24‌ ‌hour‌ ‌period‌\ 1) A‌ ‌Driver‌ ‌may‌ ‌‌drive‌‌ ‌for‌ ‌no‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌11‌ ‌hours‌ ‌per‌ ‌14‌ ‌hour‌ ‌duty‌ ‌period‌ ‌\ 2) A‌ ‌driver‌ ‌must‌ ‌take‌ ‌a‌ ‌30‌ ‌minute‌ ‌break‌ ‌every‌ ‌8‌ ‌hours‌ ‌ \ ii) CDL‌ ‌Driver’s‌ ‌must‌ ‌rest‌ ‌(be‌ ‌off‌ ‌duty)‌ ‌for‌ ‌10‌ ‌continuous‌ ‌hours‌ ‌per‌ ‌24‌ ‌hour‌ ‌period‌ ‌ ;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Not‌ ‌Maintain‌ ‌a‌ ‌logbook‌ ‌without‌ ‌indicating‌ ‌what‌ ‌times‌ ‌at‌ ‌which‌ ‌the‌ ‌driver‌ ‌went‌ ‌on‌ ‌duty,‌ ‌off‌ ‌duty,‌ ‌was‌ ‌driving,‌ ‌and‌ ‌took‌ ‌their‌ ‌required‌ ‌breaks.‌ ‌ ‌\ i) Drivers‌ ‌will‌ ‌keep‌ ‌records‌ ‌for‌ ‌7‌ ‌days‌ ‌including‌ ‌the‌ ‌current‌ ‌day.‌ ‌ Anyone‌ ‌in‌ ‌violation‌ ‌is‌ ‌guilty‌ ‌under‌ ‌this‌ ‌section‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌code‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 10(04). is an Infraction $350 10(05).‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Motor‌ ‌Vehicle‌ ‌Oversize/Overweight No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌Shall,‌\ a) Drive‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit‌ ‌any‌ ‌combination‌ ‌vehicle‌ ‌which‌ ‌weighs‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌80,000‌ ‌pounds‌ ‌Gross‌ ‌vehicle‌ ‌weight;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Drive‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit‌ ‌any‌ ‌straight‌ ‌truck box‌ ‌truck‌ ‌which‌ ‌weighs‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌40,000‌ ‌pounds‌ ‌Gross‌ ‌vehicle‌ ‌weight;‌ ‌or‌\ c) Drive‌ ‌any‌ ‌combination‌ ‌vehicle‌ ‌that‌ ‌exceeds‌ ‌75‌ ‌feet‌ ‌(23‌ ‌meters)‌ ‌in‌ ‌length‌ ‌and‌ ‌8.5‌ ‌feet‌ ‌(2.6‌ ‌meters)‌ ‌in‌ ‌width.‌ ‌ ‌\ i) Unless‌ ‌registered‌ ‌and‌ ‌approved‌ ‌by‌ ‌SAHP’s‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Vehicle‌ ‌Enforcement‌ ‌prior‌ ‌to‌ ‌departing.‌\ d) Drive‌ ‌any‌ ‌non‌ ‌combination‌ ‌vehicle‌ ‌that‌ ‌exceeds‌ ‌65‌ ‌feet‌ ‌(19.8‌ ‌meters)‌ ‌in‌ ‌length‌ ‌and‌ ‌8.5‌ ‌feet‌ ‌(2.6‌ ‌meters)‌ ‌in‌ ‌width.‌\ i) Unless‌ ‌registered‌ ‌and‌ ‌approved‌ ‌by‌ ‌SAHP’s‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Vehicle‌ ‌Enforcement‌ ‌prior‌ ‌to‌ ‌departing.‌\ \ A violation of 10(05). is an Infraction $500 10(06).‌ ‌Hazardous‌ ‌Material‌ ‌and‌ ‌Passenger‌ ‌Transportation‌ No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌Shall,‌\ a) While‌ ‌transporting‌ ‌passengers‌ ‌or‌ ‌hazardous‌ ‌materials:‌ ‌\ i) All‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌must‌ ‌come‌ ‌to‌ ‌a‌ ‌complete‌ ‌stop‌ ‌at‌ ‌ALL‌ ‌railroad‌ ‌crossings‌ ‌and‌ ‌have‌ ‌their‌ ‌emergency‌ ‌flashers‌ ‌activated‌ ‌\ ii) All‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌with‌ ‌HAZMAT‌ ‌materials‌ ‌in‌ ‌transport‌ ‌should‌ ‌have‌ ‌the‌ ‌proper‌ ‌placards,‌ ‌one‌ ‌per‌ ‌side,‌ ‌and‌ ‌one‌ ‌on‌ ‌each‌ ‌end.‌ ‌\ iii) All‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌with‌ ‌HAZMAT‌ ‌materials‌ ‌in‌ ‌transport‌ ‌shall‌ ‌not‌ ‌‌drive‌‌ ‌through‌ ‌a‌ ‌residential‌ ‌area,‌ ‌except‌ ‌when‌ ‌the‌ ‌drop‌ ‌off‌ ‌point‌ ‌is‌ ‌located‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌Residential‌ ‌area.‌\ iv) All‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌with‌ ‌HAZMAT‌ ‌materials‌ ‌in‌ ‌transport‌ ‌shall‌ ‌not‌ ‌be‌ ‌left‌ ‌unattended‌ ‌for‌ ‌any‌ ‌reason‌ ‌without‌ ‌being‌ ‌parked‌ ‌located‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌safe‌ ‌location.‌ ‌At‌ ‌no‌ ‌time‌ ‌should‌ ‌a‌ ‌HAZMAT‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌be‌ ‌parked‌ ‌on‌ ‌the‌ ‌side‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌‌road‌.‌ ‌\ v) Be‌ ‌fueling‌ ‌while‌ ‌passengers‌ ‌are‌ ‌aboard‌ ‌\ vi) Be‌ ‌smoking‌ ‌while‌ ‌aboard‌ ‌Public‌ ‌Transportation‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 10(06). is an Infraction $275

docs.text: Applicability‌ \ __ \ __This‌ ‌title‌ ‌applies‌ ‌to‌,\ a) The‌ ‌operation‌ ‌of‌ ‌any‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌that‌ ‌carries‌ ‌goods,‌ ‌‌property‌,‌ ‌or‌ ‌people‌ ‌for‌ ‌hire‌ ‌or‌ ‌any‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌with‌ ‌a‌ ‌minimum‌ ‌gross‌ ‌weight‌ ‌of‌ ‌26,001‌lbs‌ ‌(11793kg)‌ ‌These‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌are‌ ‌referred‌ ‌to‌ ‌as‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌motor‌ ‌vehicles.‌ ‌\ b) All‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌which‌ ‌must‌ ‌comply‌ ‌with‌ ‌all‌ ‌sections‌ ‌of‌ ‌Title‌ ‌8.‌ ‌ ‌\ c) Codes‌ ‌in‌ ‌this‌ ‌title‌ ‌may‌ ‌only‌ ‌be‌ ‌enforced‌ ‌by‌ ‌certified‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌inspectors.‌ ‌\ i) This‌ ‌code‌ ‌is‌ ‌enforced‌ ‌by‌ ‌the‌ ‌Los‌ ‌Santos‌ ‌Police‌ ‌Departments‌ ‌CVE‌ ‌Division,‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas‌ ‌Highway‌ ‌Patrols‌ ‌CVE ‌and‌ ‌the‌ ‌Blaine‌ ‌County‌ ‌Sheriff's‌ ‌Office‌ ‌Traffic‌ ‌Enforcement‌ ‌CVE‌ ‌Division‌

docs.text: No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌shall,\ a) Not‌ ‌have‌ ‌the‌ ‌valid‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌driver's‌ ‌license‌ ‌issued‌ ‌to‌ ‌them‌ ‌in‌ ‌their‌ ‌immediate‌ ‌‌possession‌‌ ‌at‌ ‌all‌ ‌times‌ ‌when‌ ‌driving‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌motor‌ ‌vehicle‌‌ ‌upon‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌highway‌;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Operate‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌a‌ ‌CDL:‌ ‌\ i) Any‌ ‌single‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌used‌ ‌to‌ ‌transport‌ ‌cargo‌ ‌or‌ ‌goods,‌ ‌including‌ ‌but‌ ‌not‌ ‌limited‌ ‌to‌ ‌a‌ ‌large‌ ‌dump‌ ‌truck,‌ ‌box‌ ‌truck‌ ‌or‌ ‌similar‌ ‌‌vehicle‌;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ ii) Any‌ ‌combination‌ ‌‌vehicle‌,‌ ‌including‌ ‌but‌ ‌not‌ ‌limited‌ ‌to‌ ‌a‌ ‌semi‌ ‌truck‌ ‌or‌ ‌tractor-trailer;‌ ‌or‌\ iii) A‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌designed‌ ‌to‌ ‌transport‌ ‌16‌ ‌or‌ ‌more‌ ‌passengers,‌ ‌including‌ ‌the‌ ‌driver,‌ ‌ether‌ ‌city‌ ‌or‌ ‌long‌ ‌haul‌ ‌buses‌\ \ Suspension‌ ‌of‌ ‌CDL‌ ‌License‌ ‌(if‌ ‌applicable)‌ ‌and‌ ‌$1000‌ ‌fine, this‌ ‌crime‌ ‌is‌ ‌an‌ ‌‌ Infraction‌.‌ ‌ If‌ ‌HAZMAT‌ ‌Materials‌ ‌and‌ ‌or‌ ‌Passengers‌ ‌are‌ ‌being‌ ‌transported‌, this‌ ‌crime‌ ‌is‌ ‌now‌ ‌a‌ Misdemeanor‌.‌ $200 2 Months

docs.text: No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌shall,‌\ a) Drive‌‌ ‌and‌ ‌operate‌ ‌a‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌‌motor‌ ‌vehicle‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌in‌ ‌their‌ ‌possession‌ ‌in‌ ‌addition‌ ‌to‌ ‌any‌ ‌documents‌ ‌required‌ ‌in‌ ‌any‌ ‌other‌ ‌section‌ ‌\ i) A‌ ‌duty‌ ‌log‌ ‌book‌ ‌\ 1) Except‌ ‌for‌ ‌trips‌ ‌that‌ ‌stay‌ ‌within‌ ‌that‌ ‌designated‌ ‌LGA‌ ‌\ ii) Medical‌ ‌Certificate‌ ‌\ iii) Accurate‌ ‌Cargo‌ ‌Manifest/Bill‌ ‌of‌ ‌Lading‌ ‌(for‌ ‌cargo‌ ‌carrying‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌only)‌\ \ A violation of 10(02). is an Infraction $150
docs.title: 10(02).‌ ‌Additional‌ ‌Certificate‌ ‌Requirements‌

docs.text: No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌Shall,‌\ a) Drive‌‌ ‌in‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌CMV‌ ‌Point‌ ‌System.‌ ‌ ‌\ b) A‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌‌Motor‌ ‌Vehicle‌‌ ‌Driver‌ ‌shall‌ ‌earn‌ ‌points‌ ‌(Along‌ ‌with‌ ‌a‌ ‌$250‌ ‌fine‌ ‌per‌ ‌infraction)‌ ‌on‌ ‌their‌ ‌license‌ ‌for‌ ‌violations‌ ‌that‌ ‌occur‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌‌motor‌ ‌vehicle‌.‌ ‌The‌ ‌Violations‌ ‌are‌ ‌as‌ ‌follows.‌\ i) Any‌ ‌Violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌8(33)‌ ‌-‌ ‌2‌ ‌Points‌ ‌for‌ ‌Each‌ ‌violation‌ ‌unless‌ ‌they‌ ‌are‌ ‌listed‌ ‌below‌ ‌\ 1) Inoperable‌ ‌Turn‌ ‌Signal‌ ‌-‌ ‌6‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 2) Oil/Grease/Fuel/Radiator‌ ‌Leak‌ ‌-‌ ‌4‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 3) Inoperable‌ ‌Tail‌ ‌Light‌ ‌-‌ ‌1‌ ‌point‌ ‌\ 4) Inoperable‌ ‌Headlight‌ ‌-‌ ‌6‌ ‌Points‌\ 5) Damaged‌ ‌or‌ ‌Discolored‌ ‌windshield‌ ‌-‌ ‌5‌ ‌Points‌ ‌ \ 6) Damaged/Unsecured‌ ‌or‌ ‌missing‌ ‌DOT‌ ‌bumper‌ ‌-‌ ‌5‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 7) Damaged/Missing‌ ‌DOT‌ ‌stickers‌ ‌-‌ ‌1‌ ‌Point‌ ‌and‌ ‌($50‌ ‌per‌ ‌offence)\ 8) Inoperable/Damaged‌ ‌landing‌ ‌gear‌ ‌and‌ ‌coupling‌ ‌devices‌ ‌-‌ ‌3‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 9) Flat‌ ‌Tire‌ ‌-‌ ‌8‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 10) Leaking/Falling‌ ‌Cargo‌ ‌-‌ ‌7‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 11) Inoperable/Defective‌ ‌Breaks‌ ‌-‌ ‌4‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 12) Failure‌ ‌to‌ ‌secure‌ ‌Cargo‌ ‌-‌ ‌1‌ ‌Point‌ ‌(EXCEPTION:‌ ‌Load‌ ‌was‌ ‌Pre-sealed)‌\ 13) Missing/Expired‌ ‌Fire‌ ‌Extinguisher‌ ‌-‌ ‌3‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ ii) Violations‌ ‌of‌ ‌Section‌ ‌10(01)‌ ‌or‌ ‌10(02)‌ ‌-‌ ‌3‌ ‌Points‌ ‌for‌ ‌Each‌ ‌violation‌ ‌unless‌ ‌they‌ ‌are‌ ‌listed‌ ‌below‌ ‌\ 1) No/Inaccurate‌ ‌cargo‌ ‌manifest‌ ‌-‌ ‌5‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\Over‌ ‌hour‌ ‌logbook‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌falsification‌ ‌of‌ ‌logs‌ ‌-‌ ‌10‌ ‌Points‌ ‌and‌ ‌a‌ ‌fine‌ ‌of‌ ‌$1000‌ ‌\ iii) Violations‌ ‌of‌ ‌Section‌ ‌8(19\ 1) 1-9‌ ‌MPH‌ ‌over‌ ‌the‌ ‌limit‌ ‌-‌ ‌1‌ ‌Point‌ ‌\ 2) 10-14‌ ‌MPH‌ ‌over‌ ‌the‌ ‌limit‌ ‌-‌ ‌2‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 3) 15-19‌ ‌MPH‌ ‌over‌ ‌the‌ ‌limit‌ ‌-‌ ‌3‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 4) 20-24‌ ‌MPH‌ ‌over‌ ‌the‌ ‌limit‌ ‌-‌ ‌4‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ 5) 24+‌ ‌over‌ ‌the‌ ‌limit‌ ‌-‌ ‌5‌ ‌Points‌\ iv) Violations‌ ‌of‌ ‌Section‌ ‌8(15)‌ ‌-‌ ‌4‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ v) Violations‌ ‌of‌ ‌Section‌ ‌8(22)‌ ‌-‌ ‌6‌ ‌Points‌ ‌\ c) If‌ ‌the‌ ‌violation‌ ‌puts‌ ‌the‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌out‌ ‌of‌ ‌service‌ ‌all‌ ‌violations‌ ‌from‌ ‌that‌ ‌incident‌ ‌shall‌ ‌be‌ ‌doubled‌ \ d) If‌ ‌a‌ ‌person‌ ‌obtains‌ ‌70‌ ‌points‌ ‌within‌ ‌15‌ ‌days‌ ‌his‌ ‌or‌ ‌her‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌driver's‌ ‌license‌ ‌shall‌ ‌be‌ ‌suspended‌ ‌\ i) After‌ ‌the‌ ‌suspension‌ ‌the‌ ‌amount‌ ‌of‌ ‌points‌ ‌on‌ ‌the‌ ‌license‌ ‌shall‌ ‌be‌ ‌reduced‌ ‌by‌ ‌15.‌ ‌\ e) If‌ ‌a‌ ‌person‌ ‌obtains‌ ‌3‌ ‌violations‌ ‌marked‌ ‌with‌ ‌^‌ ‌symbol‌ ‌above‌ ‌or‌ ‌listed‌ ‌below‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌15‌ ‌day‌ ‌period‌ ‌their‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Drivers‌ ‌License‌ ‌shall‌ ‌be‌ ‌suspended.‌\ \ A violation of 10(03). is an Infraction ‌ ‌ $200
docs.title: 10(03).‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Motor‌ ‌Vehicle‌ ‌Point‌ ‌System‌

docs.text: No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌Shall,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌a‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌‌motor‌ ‌vehicle‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌complying‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌duty‌ ‌day‌ ‌stipulations‌\ i) CDL‌ ‌Driver’s‌ ‌is‌ ‌only‌ ‌allowed‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌on‌ ‌duty‌ ‌for‌ ‌no‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌14‌ ‌hours‌ ‌per‌ ‌24‌ ‌hour‌ ‌period‌\ 1) A‌ ‌Driver‌ ‌may‌ ‌‌drive‌‌ ‌for‌ ‌no‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌11‌ ‌hours‌ ‌per‌ ‌14‌ ‌hour‌ ‌duty‌ ‌period‌ ‌\ 2) A‌ ‌driver‌ ‌must‌ ‌take‌ ‌a‌ ‌30‌ ‌minute‌ ‌break‌ ‌every‌ ‌8‌ ‌hours‌ ‌ \ ii) CDL‌ ‌Driver’s‌ ‌must‌ ‌rest‌ ‌(be‌ ‌off‌ ‌duty)‌ ‌for‌ ‌10‌ ‌continuous‌ ‌hours‌ ‌per‌ ‌24‌ ‌hour‌ ‌period‌ ‌ ;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Not‌ ‌Maintain‌ ‌a‌ ‌logbook‌ ‌without‌ ‌indicating‌ ‌what‌ ‌times‌ ‌at‌ ‌which‌ ‌the‌ ‌driver‌ ‌went‌ ‌on‌ ‌duty,‌ ‌off‌ ‌duty,‌ ‌was‌ ‌driving,‌ ‌and‌ ‌took‌ ‌their‌ ‌required‌ ‌breaks.‌ ‌ ‌\ i) Drivers‌ ‌will‌ ‌keep‌ ‌records‌ ‌for‌ ‌7‌ ‌days‌ ‌including‌ ‌the‌ ‌current‌ ‌day.‌ ‌ Anyone‌ ‌in‌ ‌violation‌ ‌is‌ ‌guilty‌ ‌under‌ ‌this‌ ‌section‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌code‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 10(04). is an Infraction $350
docs.title: 10(04).‌ ‌Duty‌ ‌Day‌ ‌Limits‌

docs.text: No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌Shall,‌\ a) Drive‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit‌ ‌any‌ ‌combination‌ ‌vehicle‌ ‌which‌ ‌weighs‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌80,000‌ ‌pounds‌ ‌Gross‌ ‌vehicle‌ ‌weight;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Drive‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit‌ ‌any‌ ‌straight‌ ‌truck box‌ ‌truck‌ ‌which‌ ‌weighs‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌40,000‌ ‌pounds‌ ‌Gross‌ ‌vehicle‌ ‌weight;‌ ‌or‌\ c) Drive‌ ‌any‌ ‌combination‌ ‌vehicle‌ ‌that‌ ‌exceeds‌ ‌75‌ ‌feet‌ ‌(23‌ ‌meters)‌ ‌in‌ ‌length‌ ‌and‌ ‌8.5‌ ‌feet‌ ‌(2.6‌ ‌meters)‌ ‌in‌ ‌width.‌ ‌ ‌\ i) Unless‌ ‌registered‌ ‌and‌ ‌approved‌ ‌by‌ ‌SAHP’s‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Vehicle‌ ‌Enforcement‌ ‌prior‌ ‌to‌ ‌departing.‌\ d) Drive‌ ‌any‌ ‌non‌ ‌combination‌ ‌vehicle‌ ‌that‌ ‌exceeds‌ ‌65‌ ‌feet‌ ‌(19.8‌ ‌meters)‌ ‌in‌ ‌length‌ ‌and‌ ‌8.5‌ ‌feet‌ ‌(2.6‌ ‌meters)‌ ‌in‌ ‌width.‌\ i) Unless‌ ‌registered‌ ‌and‌ ‌approved‌ ‌by‌ ‌SAHP’s‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Vehicle‌ ‌Enforcement‌ ‌prior‌ ‌to‌ ‌departing.‌\ \ A violation of 10(05). is an Infraction $500
docs.title: 10(05).‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Motor‌ ‌Vehicle‌ ‌Oversize/Overweight

docs.text: No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌Shall,‌\ a) While‌ ‌transporting‌ ‌passengers‌ ‌or‌ ‌hazardous‌ ‌materials:‌ ‌\ i) All‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌must‌ ‌come‌ ‌to‌ ‌a‌ ‌complete‌ ‌stop‌ ‌at‌ ‌ALL‌ ‌railroad‌ ‌crossings‌ ‌and‌ ‌have‌ ‌their‌ ‌emergency‌ ‌flashers‌ ‌activated‌ ‌\ ii) All‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌with‌ ‌HAZMAT‌ ‌materials‌ ‌in‌ ‌transport‌ ‌should‌ ‌have‌ ‌the‌ ‌proper‌ ‌placards,‌ ‌one‌ ‌per‌ ‌side,‌ ‌and‌ ‌one‌ ‌on‌ ‌each‌ ‌end.‌ ‌\ iii) All‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌with‌ ‌HAZMAT‌ ‌materials‌ ‌in‌ ‌transport‌ ‌shall‌ ‌not‌ ‌‌drive‌‌ ‌through‌ ‌a‌ ‌residential‌ ‌area,‌ ‌except‌ ‌when‌ ‌the‌ ‌drop‌ ‌off‌ ‌point‌ ‌is‌ ‌located‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌Residential‌ ‌area.‌\ iv) All‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌with‌ ‌HAZMAT‌ ‌materials‌ ‌in‌ ‌transport‌ ‌shall‌ ‌not‌ ‌be‌ ‌left‌ ‌unattended‌ ‌for‌ ‌any‌ ‌reason‌ ‌without‌ ‌being‌ ‌parked‌ ‌located‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌safe‌ ‌location.‌ ‌At‌ ‌no‌ ‌time‌ ‌should‌ ‌a‌ ‌HAZMAT‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌be‌ ‌parked‌ ‌on‌ ‌the‌ ‌side‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌‌road‌.‌ ‌\ v) Be‌ ‌fueling‌ ‌while‌ ‌passengers‌ ‌are‌ ‌aboard‌ ‌\ vi) Be‌ ‌smoking‌ ‌while‌ ‌aboard‌ ‌Public‌ ‌Transportation‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 10(06). is an Infraction $275
docs.title: 10(06).‌ ‌Hazardous‌ ‌Material‌ ‌and‌ ‌Passenger‌ ‌Transportation‌

docs.text: Title 11 - Operation of Aircraft 11(01).‌ ‌Pilot‌ ‌Licenses‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Pilot‌ ‌Licenses‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌an‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ ‌valid‌ ‌pilots‌ ‌license‌ ‌for‌ ‌the‌ ‌type‌ ‌of‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌being‌ ‌operated;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Have‌ ‌in‌ ‌their‌ ‌‌possession‌‌ ‌or‌ ‌otherwise‌ ‌under‌ ‌their‌ ‌control‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌one‌ ‌pilot's‌ ‌license;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ c) Fly‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌their‌ ‌SAFA‌ ‌Pilots‌ ‌license‌ ‌in‌ ‌there‌ ‌immediate‌ ‌‌possession‌\ \ A violation of 11(01). ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌ Misdemeanor‌ ‌ \ No‌ ‌Jail‌ ‌time‌ ‌is‌ ‌permitted‌ ‌with‌ ‌this‌ ‌offense‌ ‌unless‌ ‌regularly‌ ‌violated.‌ ‌ 11(02)‌ ‌Additional‌ ‌Certificate‌ ‌Requirements‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Addition‌ ‌Certificate‌ ‌Requirements‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌an‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌in‌ ‌there‌ ‌immediate‌ ‌possession‌ ‌\ i) A‌ ‌duty‌ ‌log‌ ‌book‌ ‌\ ii) Medical‌ ‌Certificate‌ ‌\ iii) Accurate‌ ‌Cargo‌ ‌Manifest‌ ‌(for‌ ‌cargo‌ ‌carrying‌ ‌vehicles‌ ‌only)‌\ \ A violation of 11(02). ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌ Misdemeanor‌ ‌ \ No‌ ‌Jail‌ ‌time‌ ‌is‌ ‌permitted‌ ‌with‌ ‌this‌ ‌offense‌ ‌unless‌ ‌regularly‌ ‌violated.‌ 11(03).‌ ‌Duty‌ ‌Day‌ ‌Limits‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌a‌ ‌Duty‌ ‌Day‌ ‌Limits‌ offense ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌an‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌while‌ ‌in‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌Duty‌ ‌Day‌ ‌terms;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ i) A‌ ‌Pilot‌ ‌may‌ ‌be‌ ‌on‌ ‌duty‌ ‌no‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌16‌ ‌hours‌ ‌per‌ ‌24‌ ‌hour‌ ‌period‌ ‌\ 1) A‌ ‌pilot‌ ‌may‌ ‌‌drive‌‌ ‌for‌ ‌no‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌8‌ ‌hours‌ ‌per‌ ‌16‌ ‌hour‌ ‌duty‌ ‌period‌ ‌\ b) A‌ ‌pilot‌ ‌shall‌ ‌maintain‌ ‌a‌ ‌logbook‌ ‌which‌ ‌indicates‌ ‌the‌ ‌time‌ ‌as‌ ‌which‌ ‌the‌ ‌driver‌ ‌went‌ ‌on‌ ‌duty,‌ ‌off‌ ‌duty,‌ ‌was‌ ‌driving,‌ ‌and‌ ‌took‌ ‌his‌ ‌or‌ ‌her‌ ‌required‌ ‌breaks‌ ‌\ i) Pilots‌ ‌will‌ ‌keep‌ ‌records‌ ‌for‌ ‌7‌ ‌day‌ ‌including‌ ‌the‌ ‌current‌ ‌day.‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 11(03). is a Misdemeanor \ No‌ ‌Jail‌ ‌time‌ ‌is‌ ‌permitted‌ ‌with‌ ‌this‌ ‌offense‌ ‌unless‌ ‌regularly‌ ‌violated.‌ ‌ 11(04).‌ ‌Required‌ ‌Equipment‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Required‌ ‌Equipment‌ ‌offense‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌an‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌that‌ ‌doesn’t‌ ‌have‌ ‌all‌ ‌equipment‌ ‌and‌ ‌lights‌ ‌working.‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 11(04). is Misdemeanor ‌ \ No‌ ‌Jail‌ ‌time‌ ‌is‌ ‌permitted‌ ‌with‌ ‌this‌ ‌offence‌ ‌unless‌ ‌regularly‌ ‌violated.‌ 11(05).‌ ‌Restricted‌ ‌Flight‌ ‌Areas‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Restricted‌ ‌Flight‌ ‌Areas‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌an‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌areas;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ i) Over‌ ‌Zancudo‌ ‌Military‌ ‌Base‌\ ii) Over‌ ‌the‌ ‌SAHP‌ ‌Headquarters,‌ ‌or‌ ‌Bolingbroke‌ ‌Penitentiary.‌ ‌\ iii) Under‌ ‌500ft‌ ‌over‌ ‌any‌ ‌building‌ ‌structure‌ ‌or‌ ‌person‌ ‌except‌ ‌when‌ ‌required‌ ‌for‌ ‌takeoff‌ ‌and‌ ‌landing‌ ‌\ 1) Excluding‌ ‌any‌ ‌Law‌ ‌Enforcement,‌ ‌Military,‌ ‌Medical,‌ ‌Fire‌ ‌Department,‌ ‌or‌ ‌any‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌appropriate‌ ‌documentation.‌ ‌\ iv) In‌ ‌such‌ ‌a‌ ‌manner‌ ‌to‌ ‌interfere‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌flight‌ ‌pattern‌ ‌at‌ ‌any‌ ‌airport‌ ‌\ b) Land‌ ‌on‌ ‌any‌ ‌location‌ ‌not‌ ‌intended‌ ‌for‌ ‌the‌ ‌operation‌ ‌of‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌except‌ ‌in‌ ‌an‌ ‌emergency.‌\ i) Excluding‌ ‌any‌ ‌Law‌ ‌Enforcement,‌ ‌Military,‌ ‌Medical,‌ ‌Fire‌ ‌Department,‌ ‌or‌ ‌any‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌appropriate‌ ‌documentation\ ii) Excluding‌ ‌any‌ ‌Helicopter‌ ‌landing‌ ‌on‌ ‌a‌ ‌private‌ ‌‌property‌‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌permission‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌owner‌\ \ A violation of 11(05). is a Misdemeanor \ Suspension‌ ‌of‌ ‌SAFA‌ ‌License‌ ‌for‌ ‌3‌ ‌days,‌ ‌No‌ ‌Jail‌ ‌time‌ ‌is‌ ‌permitted‌ ‌with‌ ‌this‌ ‌offence‌ ‌unless‌ ‌regularly‌ ‌violated.‌ ‌ 11(06).‌ ‌Flying‌ ‌Under‌ ‌the‌ ‌Influence‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Flying‌ ‌Under‌ ‌the‌ ‌Influence‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌any‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌conditions‌ ‌\ i) Having‌ ‌had‌ ‌alcohol‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌last‌ ‌8‌ ‌hours‌ ‌\ ii) With‌ ‌a‌ ‌blood‌ ‌alcohol‌ ‌level‌ ‌over‌ ‌0.04%‌ ‌\ iii) Under‌ ‌the‌ ‌influence‌ ‌of‌ ‌any‌ ‌drug‌ ‌contrary‌ ‌to‌ ‌safety‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 11(06). is a Misdemeanor \ Suspension‌ ‌of‌ ‌SAFA‌ License ‌for‌ ‌3‌ ‌days,‌ ‌No‌ ‌Jail‌ ‌time‌ ‌is‌ ‌permitted‌ ‌with‌ ‌this‌ offense ‌unless‌ regularly‌ ‌violated.‌ ‌

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Required‌ ‌Equipment‌ ‌offense‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌an‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌that‌ ‌doesn’t‌ ‌have‌ ‌all‌ ‌equipment‌ ‌and‌ ‌lights‌ ‌working.‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 11(04). is Misdemeanor ‌ \ No‌ ‌Jail‌ ‌time‌ ‌is‌ ‌permitted‌ ‌with‌ ‌this‌ ‌offence‌ ‌unless‌ ‌regularly‌ ‌violated.‌
docs.title: 11(04).‌ ‌Required‌ ‌Equipment‌

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Restricted‌ ‌Flight‌ ‌Areas‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌an‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌areas;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ i) Over‌ ‌Zancudo‌ ‌Military‌ ‌Base‌\ ii) Over‌ ‌the‌ ‌SAHP‌ ‌Headquarters,‌ ‌or‌ ‌Bolingbroke‌ ‌Penitentiary.‌ ‌\ iii) Under‌ ‌500ft‌ ‌over‌ ‌any‌ ‌building‌ ‌structure‌ ‌or‌ ‌person‌ ‌except‌ ‌when‌ ‌required‌ ‌for‌ ‌takeoff‌ ‌and‌ ‌landing‌ ‌\ 1) Excluding‌ ‌any‌ ‌Law‌ ‌Enforcement,‌ ‌Military,‌ ‌Medical,‌ ‌Fire‌ ‌Department,‌ ‌or‌ ‌any‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌appropriate‌ ‌documentation.‌ ‌\ iv) In‌ ‌such‌ ‌a‌ ‌manner‌ ‌to‌ ‌interfere‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌flight‌ ‌pattern‌ ‌at‌ ‌any‌ ‌airport‌ ‌\ b) Land‌ ‌on‌ ‌any‌ ‌location‌ ‌not‌ ‌intended‌ ‌for‌ ‌the‌ ‌operation‌ ‌of‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌except‌ ‌in‌ ‌an‌ ‌emergency.‌\ i) Excluding‌ ‌any‌ ‌Law‌ ‌Enforcement,‌ ‌Military,‌ ‌Medical,‌ ‌Fire‌ ‌Department,‌ ‌or‌ ‌any‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌appropriate‌ ‌documentation\ ii) Excluding‌ ‌any‌ ‌Helicopter‌ ‌landing‌ ‌on‌ ‌a‌ ‌private‌ ‌‌property‌‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌permission‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌owner‌\ \ A violation of 11(05). is a Misdemeanor \ Suspension‌ ‌of‌ ‌SAFA‌ ‌License‌ ‌for‌ ‌3‌ ‌days,‌ ‌No‌ ‌Jail‌ ‌time‌ ‌is‌ ‌permitted‌ ‌with‌ ‌this‌ ‌offence‌ ‌unless‌ ‌regularly‌ ‌violated.‌ ‌
docs.title: 11(05).‌ ‌Restricted‌ ‌Flight‌ ‌Areas‌

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Flying‌ ‌Under‌ ‌the‌ ‌Influence‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌any‌ ‌aircraft‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌conditions‌ ‌\ i) Having‌ ‌had‌ ‌alcohol‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌last‌ ‌8‌ ‌hours‌ ‌\ ii) With‌ ‌a‌ ‌blood‌ ‌alcohol‌ ‌level‌ ‌over‌ ‌0.04%‌ ‌\ iii) Under‌ ‌the‌ ‌influence‌ ‌of‌ ‌any‌ ‌drug‌ ‌contrary‌ ‌to‌ ‌safety‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 11(06). is a Misdemeanor \ Suspension‌ ‌of‌ ‌SAFA‌ License ‌for‌ ‌3‌ ‌days,‌ ‌No‌ ‌Jail‌ ‌time‌ ‌is‌ ‌permitted‌ ‌with‌ ‌this‌ offense ‌unless‌ regularly‌ ‌violated.‌ ‌
docs.title: 11(06).‌ ‌Flying‌ ‌Under‌ ‌the‌ ‌Influence‌

docs.text: Title 12 - Operation of Marine Vessels Applicability‌ \ __ This‌ ‌title‌ ‌applies‌ ‌to‌ ‌\ a) The‌ ‌operations‌ ‌of‌ ‌any‌ ‌vessel,‌ ‌to‌ ‌include‌ ‌jet‌ ‌skis.‌ ‌Only‌ ‌certified‌ ‌vessel‌ ‌inspectors‌ ‌may‌ ‌enforce‌ ‌codes‌ ‌Under‌ ‌this‌ ‌title.‌ ‌Members‌ ‌of‌ ‌LSPD‌ ‌Port‌ ‌Authority,‌ ‌SAHP‌ ‌Coastal‌ ‌Operations,‌ ‌and‌ ‌BCSO‌ ‌Wildlife‌ ‌units‌ ‌that‌ ‌are‌ ‌certified‌ ‌vessel‌ ‌inspectors.‌ ‌ ‌\ b) All‌ ‌marine‌ ‌vessels‌ ‌must‌ ‌comply‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌sections:‌ ‌\ i) 8(26).‌ ‌Driving‌ ‌Under‌ ‌the‌ ‌Influence‌\ ii) 8(27).‌ ‌Driving‌ ‌Under‌ ‌the‌ ‌Influence‌ ‌as‌ ‌a‌ ‌Minor‌ ‌\ iii) 8(28).‌ ‌Enhanced‌ ‌Driving‌ ‌Under‌ ‌the‌ ‌Influence‌\ iv) 8(29).‌ ‌Open‌ ‌Container‌ 12(01).‌ ‌Operating‌ ‌a‌ ‌Marine‌ ‌Vessel‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ ‌Maritime‌ ‌License‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌shall‌ ‌not‌,\ a) Operate‌ ‌any‌ ‌water‌ ‌vessel,‌ ‌without‌ ‌‌possessing‌‌ ‌a‌ ‌valid‌ ‌and‌ ‌current‌ ‌boating‌ ‌operators‌ ‌license.‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 12(01). is an Infraction ‌ $150 12(02).‌ ‌Equipment‌ No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌Shall‌,\ a) Operate‌ ‌a‌ ‌Marine‌ ‌Vessel‌ ‌without‌ ‌the‌ ‌appropriate‌ ‌equipment‌ ‌in‌ ‌working‌ ‌order‌ ‌and‌ ‌onboard‌ ‌\ i) All‌ ‌lights‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌working‌ ‌and‌ ‌operational.‌ ‌\ ii) PFD‌ ‌available‌ ‌for‌ ‌each‌ ‌person‌ ‌onboard‌ ‌the‌ ‌vessel‌ ‌(they‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌worn)‌ ‌\ iii) Basic‌ ‌First‌ ‌Aid‌ ‌Kit‌ ‌\ iv) Functional‌ ‌2‌ ‌way‌ ‌radio‌ ‌tuned‌ ‌to‌ ‌the‌ ‌appropriate‌ ‌frequency‌ ‌\ v) Fire‌ ‌suppression‌ ‌system‌ ‌(i.e.‌ ‌Fire‌ ‌Extinguisher,‌ ‌Sprinkler‌ ‌System )‌ \ *\ *A violation of 12(02). is an Infraction $250 12(03).‌ ‌Speed‌ ‌Limits‌ No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌Shall‌,\ a) Exceed‌ ‌a‌ ‌maximum‌ ‌speed‌ ‌limit‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌areas‌ ‌defined‌ ‌below‌ ‌\ i) Speed‌ ‌Limit‌ ‌of‌ ‌15‌ ‌mph‌ ‌enforced‌ ‌within‌ ‌any‌ ‌Harbor‌ ‌or‌ ‌“no‌ ‌wake‌ ‌zone”‌ ‌determined‌ ‌by‌ ‌marked‌ ‌buoys,‌ ‌signs‌ ‌or‌ ‌other‌ ‌indicators.‌ ‌\ ii) Speed‌ ‌Limit‌ ‌of‌ ‌20‌ ‌mph‌ ‌enforced‌ ‌within‌ ‌25‌ ‌meters‌ ‌of‌ ‌any‌ ‌designated‌ ‌swimming‌ ‌area,‌ ‌public‌ ‌or‌ ‌private‌ ‌\ iii) Speed‌ ‌Limit‌ ‌of‌ ‌25‌ ‌mph‌ ‌enforced‌ ‌within‌ ‌25‌ ‌meters‌ ‌of‌ ‌any‌ ‌coast‌ ‌or‌ ‌shoreline‌ ‌when‌ ‌not‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌designated‌ ‌swim‌ ‌area,‌ ‌public‌ ‌or‌ ‌private.‌ ‌\ iv) No‌ ‌Speed‌ ‌limit‌ ‌enforced‌ ‌on‌ ‌any‌ ‌water‌ ‌considered‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌“open‌ ‌seas”‌ ‌however‌ ‌a‌ ‌vessel‌ ‌is‌ ‌considered‌ ‌operating‌ ‌in‌ ‌an‌ ‌unsafe‌ ‌or‌ ‌reckless‌ ‌manor‌ ‌anytime‌ ‌when‌ ‌it's‌ ‌speeds‌ ‌exceed‌ ‌what‌ ‌is‌ ‌fit‌ ‌for‌ ‌the‌ ‌conditions‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 12(03). is an Infraction \ Violations‌ ‌of‌ ‌this‌ ‌offense‌ ‌are‌ ‌escalated‌ ‌if‌ ‌repeated‌ ‌over‌ ‌a‌ ‌1‌ ‌week‌ ‌timeframe‌. Upon‌ ‌a‌ ‌third‌ ‌violation,‌ ‌the‌ ‌boater’s‌ ‌maritime‌ ‌license‌ ‌can‌ ‌be‌ ‌suspended‌ ‌for‌ ‌3‌ ‌days‌ ‌(in‌ ‌game)‌ ‌at‌ ‌the‌ ‌discretion‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌law‌ ‌enforcement‌ ‌officer.‌ $250 12(04).‌ ‌Restricted‌ ‌Areas‌ No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌Shall‌,\ a) Operate‌ ‌a‌ ‌Marine‌ ‌Vessel‌ ‌in‌ ‌any‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌Areas‌ ‌unless‌ ‌you‌ ‌are‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌government‌ ‌owned‌ ‌vessel‌ ‌on‌ ‌official‌ ‌business:‌ ‌\ i) Within‌ ‌500ft‌ ‌of‌ ‌Fort‌ ‌Zancudo‌ ‌Military‌ ‌Base‌ ‌\ ii) Within‌ ‌500ft‌ ‌of‌ ‌Los‌ ‌Santos‌ ‌International‌ ‌Airport‌ ‌\ iii) Any‌ ‌area‌ ‌marked‌ ‌“Not‌ ‌for‌ ‌Entry‌ ‌by‌ ‌Boats”‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 12(04). is an Infraction $400

docs.text: Title 13 - Fish and Game 13(01). Prohibition on Hunting No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌Shall‌ a) Hunt,‌ ‌capture,‌ ‌bait,‌ ‌lure,‌ ‌or‌ ‌attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌hunt,‌ ‌capture,‌ ‌bait‌ ‌or‌ ‌lure‌ ‌any‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌animals‌ i)Domesticated‌ ‌Animals‌ 1)Exempt‌ ‌from‌ ‌this‌ ‌are‌ ‌feral‌ ‌animals‌ ‌that‌ ‌have‌ ‌become‌ ‌a‌ ‌nuisance‌ ‌or‌ ‌hazard,‌ ‌once‌ ‌captured,‌ ‌the‌ ‌animal‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌transported‌ ‌to‌ ‌an‌ ‌animal‌ ‌care‌ ‌facility‌ ‌for‌ ‌treatment‌ ‌and/euthanized ‌by‌ ‌a‌ ‌licensed‌ ‌veterinarian.‌ ii) Farm animals 1) Exempt‌ ‌from‌ ‌this‌ ‌are‌ ‌farmers‌ ‌or‌ ‌farmhands,‌ ‌who‌ ‌may‌ ‌humanely‌ ‌euthanize‌ ‌their‌ ‌own‌ ‌livestock‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌confines‌ ‌of‌ ‌their‌ ‌own‌ ‌‌property‌. iii) Aquatic‌ ‌Animals‌ ‌(as‌ ‌listed)‌ 1)Dolphins‌ ‌ 2)Whales‌ 3)Sharks‌ ‌ 4)Stingrays‌ ‌ 5)Any‌ ‌animal‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌Marine‌ ‌wildlife‌ ‌protection‌ ‌habitat‌ iv) Birds of prey v) Cormorant vii) A young animal, nest or eggs b) Any‌ ‌Person‌ ‌who‌ ‌harms‌ ‌any‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌animals‌ ‌above‌ ‌for‌ ‌an‌ ‌act‌ ‌of‌ ‌self‌ defense ‌which‌ ‌has‌ ‌been‌ ‌proven‌ ‌as‌ ‌such‌ ‌can‌ ‌not‌ ‌be‌ ‌charged‌ ‌in‌ ‌this‌ ‌section‌. A‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌13(01)‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ Misdemeanor‌.‌ ‌ It‌ ‌is‌ ‌the‌ ‌at‌ ‌the‌ ‌sole‌ ‌discretion‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌Wildlife‌ ‌Rangers‌ ‌if‌ ‌the‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌equipment,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌hunted‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌are‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌. 5 Months 13(02) ‌. Hunting‌ ‌Permits‌ No person shall a) Attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌or‌ ‌successfully‌ ‌hunt,‌ ‌capture,‌ ‌bait,‌ ‌or‌ ‌lure‌ ‌any‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌animals‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit‌ ‌from‌ ‌the‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌service‌ ‌of‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas.‌ i) Boar ii) Coyote iii) Crow iv) Deer v) Fish vi) Mountain Lion vii) Pigeon viii) Rabbit b) The‌ ‌Fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌Game‌ ‌service‌ ‌may‌ ‌impose‌ ‌limits‌ ‌and‌ ‌requirements‌ ‌that‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌met‌ ‌in‌ ‌order‌ ‌to‌ ‌issue‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit‌. c) The‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌service‌ ‌may‌ ‌issue‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit‌ ‌for‌ ‌one‌ ‌type‌ ‌of‌ ‌animal‌ ‌or‌ ‌multiple‌ ‌types‌ ‌of‌ ‌animals‌. d) A‌ ‌person‌ ‌must‌ ‌display‌ ‌their‌ ‌permit‌ ‌to‌ ‌a‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌warden‌ ‌upon‌ ‌request.‌ A violation of 13(02) is an Infraction . Enforcing‌ ‌Wardens‌ ‌Discretion‌ ‌if‌ ‌the‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌equipment,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌hunted‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌are‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌.‌ ‌Revocation‌ ‌of‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌permits‌ ‌at‌ ‌the‌ ‌discretion‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌primary‌ ‌Fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌Game‌ ‌Warden.‌ $300 13(03). Daily‌ ‌Limits‌ ‌and‌ ‌Possession‌ ‌Limits‌ No person shall **** a) Kill‌ ‌or‌ ‌attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌kill‌ ‌an‌ ‌animal‌ ‌in‌ ‌excess‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌limits‌ ‌listed‌ ‌below‌ * i) * Boar 1) No Limit ii) Coyote 1) No Limit iii) Crow 1) No Limit iv) Deer 1) Antlered‌ ‌Buck‌ ‌Deer:‌ ‌One‌ ‌per‌ ‌Tag,‌ ‌One‌ ‌per‌ ‌Day,‌ ‌Three‌ ‌per‌ ‌Year‌ 2) Antlerless‌ ‌Deer:‌ ‌One‌ ‌per‌ ‌Tag,‌ ‌One‌ ‌per‌ ‌Day,‌ ‌Two‌ ‌per‌ ‌Year‌ v) Mountain Lions 1) 1‌ ‌Per‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌/‌ ‌Tag‌ ‌Issued‌ vi) Pigeon 1) 2‌ ‌per‌ ‌day,‌ ‌6‌ ‌total‌ ‌in‌ ‌possession‌ vii) Rabbit 1) 10‌ ‌per‌ ‌day,‌ ‌30‌ ‌total‌ ‌in‌ ‌possession‌ viii) Clams 1) Size‌ ‌Requirement:‌ ‌Minimum‌ ‌height‌ ‌of‌ ‌1”‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌50‌ ‌Commercial:‌ ‌No‌ ‌Limit‌ ix) Crappie & Sunfish 1) Size‌ ‌Requirements:‌ ‌Minimum‌ ‌Length‌ ‌of‌ ‌10”‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌25‌ x) Black Bass 1) Size‌ ‌Requirements:‌ ‌None‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌5‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌300‌ ‌Pounds‌ ‌(136kg)‌ xi) White Bass 1) Size‌ ‌Requirements:‌ ‌None‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌No‌ ‌Limit‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌No‌ ‌Limit‌ xii) Striped Bass 1) Size‌ ‌Requirements:‌ ‌28”‌ ‌-‌ ‌43”‌ ‌in‌ ‌Length‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌2‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌15‌ xiii) Perch 1) Size‌ ‌Requirement:‌ ‌None‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌45‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌No‌ ‌Limit‌ xiv) White‌ ‌Sturgeon‌ 1) Size‌ ‌Requirements:‌ ‌4”‌ ‌-‌ ‌60”‌ ‌in‌ ‌Length‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌1‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌Prohibited‌ xv) Halibut‌ 1) Size‌ ‌Requirement:‌ ‌Minimum‌ ‌Length‌ ‌of‌ ‌22”‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌3‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌Prohibited‌ xvi) Salmon‌ 1) Size‌ ‌Requirement:‌ ‌None‌ Recreational:‌ ‌5‌ 2) Commercial:‌ ‌No‌ ‌Limit‌ xvii) Tilapia‌ 1) Size‌ ‌Requirement:‌ ‌None‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌No‌ ‌limit‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌No‌ ‌Limit‌ A violation of 13(03) ‌is‌ ‌an‌ ‌‌ Infraction‌ .‌ ‌ Relevant‌ ‌game‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌equipment‌ ‌may‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌ ‌at‌ ‌the‌ ‌discretion‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌law‌ ‌enforcement‌ ‌officer.‌ ‌ $300 13(04). Daily‌ ‌Limits‌ ‌and‌ ‌Possession‌ ‌Limits‌ ‌-‌ ‌Excessive‌ ‌Violations‌ No person shall a) Possess‌‌ ‌or‌ ‌take‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌field‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌three‌ ‌times‌ ‌the‌ ‌daily‌ ‌bag‌ ‌limit,‌ ‌or‌ ‌who‌ ‌illegally‌ ‌‌possesses‌‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌three‌ ‌times‌ ‌the‌ ‌legal‌ ‌‌possession‌‌ ‌limit‌ ‌is‌ ‌in‌ ‌violation‌. ‌ A violation of 13(04) is a Misdemeanor . Enforcing‌ ‌Wardens‌ ‌must‌ ‌seize‌ ‌the‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌equipment,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌hunted‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game.‌ 4 Months 13(05) Hunting‌ ‌Hours No person shall a) Attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌or‌ ‌successfully‌ ‌hunt,‌ ‌capture,‌ ‌bait,‌ ‌or‌ ‌lure‌ ‌any‌ ‌between‌ ‌the‌ ‌hours‌ ‌of‌ ‌‌sunset‌‌ ‌and‌ ‌‌sunrise‌.‌ A violation of 13(05) ‌is‌ ‌an‌ ‌‌ Infraction‌ .‌ ‌ $120 13(06) Hunting‌ ‌Methods‌ a) **** Hunt‌ ‌with‌ ‌firearms‌ ‌that‌ ‌do‌ ‌not‌ ‌meet‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌firearm‌ ‌or‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌types: i) ‌bolt‌ ‌action,‌ ‌or‌ ‌semi-automatic‌ ‌rifle.‌ ii) Shotguns‌ ‌that‌ ‌fire‌ ‌as‌ ‌semi-automatic‌ ; or b) use‌ ‌a‌ ‌melee‌ ‌weaponry‌ ‌(e.g.‌ ‌bats,‌ ‌knives,‌ ‌axes,‌ ‌and‌ ‌so‌ ‌forth)‌ ‌for‌ ‌hunting;‌ ‌or‌ ‌ c) use‌ ‌poison‌ ‌for‌ ‌hunting;‌ ‌or‌ d) Hunt‌ ‌for‌ ‌aquatic‌ ‌species‌ ‌in‌ ‌manners‌ ‌other‌ ‌than‌ ‌with‌ ‌use‌ ‌of‌ ‌rod‌ ‌and‌ ‌reel,‌ ‌a‌ ‌spear,‌ ‌or‌ ‌a‌ ‌net‌ ‌unless‌ ‌licensed‌ ‌for‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌fishing‌ ‌by‌ ‌the‌ ‌State‌ ‌of‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas;‌ ‌or‌ e) Hold‌ ‌a‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌fishing‌ ‌license‌ ‌and‌ ‌fail‌ ‌to‌ ‌comply‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌standards‌ ‌when‌ ‌using‌ ‌nets‌ ‌or‌ ‌cages:‌ ‌ i) Any‌ ‌nets‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌cages‌ ‌used‌ ‌for‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌fishing‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌made‌ ‌of‌ ‌a‌ ‌biodegradable‌ ‌material‌ ‌so‌ ‌that‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌event‌ ‌of‌ ‌its ‌disconnection‌ ‌from‌ ‌the‌ ‌fish‌ ‌vessel,‌ ‌it‌ ‌will‌ ‌not‌ ‌cause‌ ‌long-term,‌ ‌adverse‌ ‌effect‌ ‌to‌ ‌marine‌ ‌life‌ ‌and‌ ‌public‌ ‌health.‌ A‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌13(06)‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌ Misdemeanor‌ .‌ ‌ Enforcing‌ ‌Wardens‌ ‌Discretion‌ ‌if‌ ‌the‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌equipment,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌hunted‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌are‌‌ to‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌.‌ ‌ 4 Months 13(07) Hunting‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌Influence‌ No person shall a) Attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌or‌ ‌successfully‌ ‌hunt,‌ ‌capture,‌ ‌bait,‌ ‌or‌ ‌lure‌ ‌any‌ ‌animals‌ ‌while‌ ‌intoxicated‌ ‌by‌ ‌any‌ ‌forms‌. ‌ i.e.‌ ‌Alcohol‌ ‌or‌ ‌Drugs.‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ A violation of 13(07) ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌ Misdemeanor‌ .‌ ‌ Enforcing‌ ‌Wardens‌ ‌Discretion‌ ‌if‌ ‌the‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌equipment,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌hunted‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌are‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌.‌ ‌ 10 Months 13(08) ‌Poaching‌ No person shall a) Illegally‌ ‌take,‌ ‌possess,‌ ‌import,‌ ‌export,‌ ‌sell,‌ ‌purchases,‌ ‌barters,‌ ‌trades,‌ ‌or‌ ‌exchanges‌ ‌an‌ ‌animal,‌ ‌or‌ ‌part‌ ‌of‌ ‌any‌ ‌of‌ ‌those‌ ‌animals,‌ ‌for‌ ‌profit‌ ‌or‌ ‌personal‌ ‌gain‌. ‌ A violation of 13(08) ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌ Misdemeanor‌ .‌ ‌ Enforcing‌ ‌Wardens‌ ‌Discretion‌ ‌if‌ ‌the‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌equipment,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌hunted‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌are‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌.‌ ‌ 10 Months 13(09) ‌Use‌ ‌of‌ ‌Animals‌ No person shall a) Capture ‌or‌ ‌destroy‌ ‌any‌ ‌deer‌ ‌and‌ ‌detach‌ ‌or‌ ‌remove‌ ‌from‌ ‌the‌ ‌carcass‌ ‌only‌ ‌the‌ ‌head,‌ ‌hide,‌ ‌antlers,‌ ‌or‌ ‌horns;‌ ‌nor‌ ‌shall‌ ‌any‌ ‌person‌ ‌at‌ ‌any‌ ‌time‌ ‌leave‌ ‌through‌ ‌carelessness‌ ‌or‌ ‌neglect‌ ‌any‌ ‌game‌ ‌mammal‌ ‌or‌ ‌game‌ ‌bird‌ ‌which‌ ‌is‌ ‌in‌ ‌their‌ ‌‌possession‌,‌ ‌or‌ ‌any‌ ‌portion‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌flesh‌ ‌usually‌ ‌eaten‌ ‌by‌ ‌humans,‌ ‌to‌ ‌go‌ ‌needlessly‌ ‌to‌ ‌waste.‌ ‌ A violation ‌of 13(09) is‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌ Misdemeanor‌ .‌ ‌ Enforcing‌ ‌Wardens‌ ‌Discretion‌ ‌if‌ ‌the‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌equipment,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌hunted‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌are‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌.‌ ‌ 6 Months 13(10) Authorized‌ ‌Hunting‌ ‌and‌ ‌Fishing‌ ‌Areas‌ No person shall a) Hunt‌ ‌within‌ ‌any‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌areas‌ ‌as‌ ‌zoned‌ ‌or‌ ‌designated‌ ‌by‌ ‌the‌ ‌state‌ ‌of‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas‌ ‌or‌ ‌by‌ ‌the‌ ‌Federal‌ ‌Government‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌United‌ ‌States‌ ‌of‌ ‌America: i) Commercial‌ ‌‌Property‌ ii) Residential‌ ‌‌Property‌ iii) National‌ ‌Parks‌ iv) Nature‌ ‌Preserves‌ v) Protected‌ ‌Wilderness‌ ‌Areas‌ b) No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌may‌ ‌hunt‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌conditions: i) Within‌ ‌150‌ ‌yards‌ ‌(137‌ ‌meters)‌ ‌of‌ ‌any‌ ‌dwelling‌ ii) On‌ ‌or‌ ‌over‌ ‌any‌ ‌‌roadway‌‌ ‌recognized ‌by‌ ‌the‌ ‌State‌ ‌of‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas‌ ‌Department‌ ‌of‌ Transportation,‌ ‌regardless‌ ‌of‌ ‌type‌ A violation of 13(10) ‌is‌ ‌an‌ ‌‌ Infraction‌ .‌ ‌ Relevant‌ ‌game‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌equipment‌ ‌may‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌ ‌at‌ ‌the‌ ‌discretion‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌law‌ ‌enforcement‌ ‌officer.‌ $400 13(11) Commercial‌ ‌Fishing No person shall a) Operate‌ ‌a‌ ‌sea‌ ‌vessel‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌intent‌ ‌to‌ ‌fish‌ ‌(as‌ ‌defined‌ ‌in‌ ‌title‌ ‌13‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas‌ ‌Legal‌ ‌Code‌ ‌and‌ ‌the‌ ‌associated‌ ‌sections)‌ ‌without‌ ‌adhering‌ ‌to‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌restrictions‌ ‌and‌ ‌regulations: ‌ i) The‌ ‌captain ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌vessel‌ ‌‌possess‌‌ ‌a‌ ‌valid‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌fishing‌ ‌license‌. 1) Validity‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌license‌ ‌is‌ ‌subject‌ ‌to‌ ‌scrutinization by‌ ‌certified‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌wardens‌ ‌as‌ ‌defined‌ ‌in‌ ‌Title‌ ‌13‌ ‌Applicability‌ ‌section‌. ii) The‌ ‌vessel‌ ‌used‌ ‌is‌ ‌registered‌ ‌as‌ ‌Commercial‌.‌ ‌For-Profit‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌State‌ ‌of‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas.‌ iii) The‌ ‌means‌ ‌of‌ ‌fishing‌ ‌must‌ ‌comply‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌Standards‌ ‌as‌ ‌regulation‌ ‌set‌ ‌forth‌ ‌in‌ ‌Penal‌ ‌Code‌ ‌13(06)‌ ‌Hunting‌ ‌Methods.‌ ‌ iv) The‌ ‌amount‌ ‌of‌ ‌caught‌ ‌fish‌ ‌is‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌limits‌ ‌set‌ ‌forth‌ ‌by‌ ‌13(03)‌ ‌Daily‌ ‌Limits‌ ‌&‌ ‌Possessions‌ ‌Limits‌. A violation of 13(11) ‌is‌ ‌an‌ ‌‌ Infraction‌ .‌ ‌ Relevant‌ ‌game‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌equipment‌ ‌may‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌ ‌at‌ ‌the‌ ‌discretion‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌law‌ ‌enforcement‌ ‌officer. $300 13(12) Conservation‌ ‌of‌ ‌Natural‌ ‌Resources‌ No person shall a) Mine/‌ ‌clear/‌ ‌cut/‌ ‌destroy‌ ‌a‌ ‌Natural‌ ‌Resource‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ license ‌from‌ ‌the‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas‌ ‌Department‌ ‌of‌ ‌Natural‌ ‌Resources‌ ‌any‌ ‌minerals‌ ‌and‌ ‌or‌ ‌ores,‌ ‌logging‌ ‌of‌ ‌trees,‌ ‌and‌ ‌or‌ ‌other‌ ‌forms‌ ‌of‌ ‌gathering,‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌confines‌ ‌of‌ ‌state‌ ‌and/‌ ‌or‌ ‌federally‌ ‌owned‌ ‌land.‌ b) Any‌ ‌person‌ ‌actively‌ ‌mining,‌ ‌logging,‌ ‌or‌ ‌gathering‌ ‌natural‌ ‌resources,‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌confines‌ ‌of‌ ‌state‌ ‌and/‌ ‌or‌ ‌federally‌ ‌owned‌ ‌land,‌ ‌is‌ ‌responsible‌ ‌to‌ ‌hold‌ ‌the‌ ‌proper‌ ‌licensing‌ ‌and/‌ ‌or‌ ‌permits‌ ‌for‌ ‌such‌ ‌activities‌ ‌if‌ ‌done‌ ‌on‌ ‌a‌ ‌scale‌ ‌larger‌ ‌than‌ ‌that‌ ‌for‌ ‌recreational‌ ‌purposes.‌ ‌ c) Persons‌ ‌found‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌mining,‌ ‌logging,‌ ‌or‌ ‌gathering‌ ‌natural‌ ‌resources‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌confines‌ ‌of‌ ‌state‌ ‌and/‌ ‌or‌ ‌federally‌ ‌owned‌ ‌land‌ ‌outside‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌confines‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌allowed‌ ‌terms‌ ‌of‌ ‌their‌ ‌issued‌ ‌licensing‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌permits‌ ‌are‌ ‌in‌ ‌violation‌. d) Persons‌ ‌found‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌mining,‌ ‌logging,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌gathering‌ ‌natural‌ ‌resources,‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌confines‌ ‌of‌ ‌state‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌federally‌ ‌owned‌ ‌land,‌ ‌outside‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌recreational‌ ‌scope‌ ‌and‌ ‌without‌ ‌the‌ ‌necessary‌ ‌licensing‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌permits‌ ‌are‌ ‌in‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌this‌ ‌code.‌ ‌Exemptions‌: i) Small‌ ‌scale‌ ‌digging,‌ ‌tree-trimming,‌ ‌tree-chopping,‌ ‌harvesting‌ ‌of‌ ‌plants,‌ ‌berries‌ ‌or‌ ‌other‌ ‌gathering‌ ‌/‌ ‌usage‌ ‌of‌ ‌natural‌ ‌resources,‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌confines‌ ‌of‌ ‌state‌ ‌and/‌ ‌or‌ ‌federally‌ ‌owned‌ ‌land,‌ ‌for‌ ‌recreational‌ ‌usage‌ ‌is‌ ‌permitted‌. A violation of 13(12) ‌is‌ ‌a‌ Felony‌ .‌ ‌ ‌ Any‌ ‌money‌ ‌made‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌illegal‌ ‌harvest‌ ‌of‌ ‌a‌ ‌natural‌ ‌resource‌ ‌is‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌ ‌and‌ ‌given‌ ‌to‌ ‌the‌ ‌State‌ ‌Government‌ ‌of‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas.‌ 22 Months
docs.title: Title 13 - Fish and Game

docs.text: No‌ ‌Person‌ ‌Shall‌ a) Hunt,‌ ‌capture,‌ ‌bait,‌ ‌lure,‌ ‌or‌ ‌attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌hunt,‌ ‌capture,‌ ‌bait‌ ‌or‌ ‌lure‌ ‌any‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌animals‌ i)Domesticated‌ ‌Animals‌ 1)Exempt‌ ‌from‌ ‌this‌ ‌are‌ ‌feral‌ ‌animals‌ ‌that‌ ‌have‌ ‌become‌ ‌a‌ ‌nuisance‌ ‌or‌ ‌hazard,‌ ‌once‌ ‌captured,‌ ‌the‌ ‌animal‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌transported‌ ‌to‌ ‌an‌ ‌animal‌ ‌care‌ ‌facility‌ ‌for‌ ‌treatment‌ ‌and/euthanized ‌by‌ ‌a‌ ‌licensed‌ ‌veterinarian.‌ ii) Farm animals 1) Exempt‌ ‌from‌ ‌this‌ ‌are‌ ‌farmers‌ ‌or‌ ‌farmhands,‌ ‌who‌ ‌may‌ ‌humanely‌ ‌euthanize‌ ‌their‌ ‌own‌ ‌livestock‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌confines‌ ‌of‌ ‌their‌ ‌own‌ ‌‌property‌. iii) Aquatic‌ ‌Animals‌ ‌(as‌ ‌listed)‌ 1)Dolphins‌ ‌ 2)Whales‌ 3)Sharks‌ ‌ 4)Stingrays‌ ‌ 5)Any‌ ‌animal‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌Marine‌ ‌wildlife‌ ‌protection‌ ‌habitat‌ iv) Birds of prey v) Cormorant vii) A young animal, nest or eggs b) Any‌ ‌Person‌ ‌who‌ ‌harms‌ ‌any‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌animals‌ ‌above‌ ‌for‌ ‌an‌ ‌act‌ ‌of‌ ‌self‌ defense ‌which‌ ‌has‌ ‌been‌ ‌proven‌ ‌as‌ ‌such‌ ‌can‌ ‌not‌ ‌be‌ ‌charged‌ ‌in‌ ‌this‌ ‌section‌. A‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌13(01)‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ Misdemeanor‌.‌ ‌ It‌ ‌is‌ ‌the‌ ‌at‌ ‌the‌ ‌sole‌ ‌discretion‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌Wildlife‌ ‌Rangers‌ ‌if‌ ‌the‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌equipment,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌hunted‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌are‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌. 5 Months
docs.title: 13(01). Prohibition on Hunting

docs.text: No person shall a) Attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌or‌ ‌successfully‌ ‌hunt,‌ ‌capture,‌ ‌bait,‌ ‌or‌ ‌lure‌ ‌any‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌animals‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit‌ ‌from‌ ‌the‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌service‌ ‌of‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas.‌ i) Boar ii) Coyote iii) Crow iv) Deer v) Fish vi) Mountain Lion vii) Pigeon viii) Rabbit b) The‌ ‌Fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌Game‌ ‌service‌ ‌may‌ ‌impose‌ ‌limits‌ ‌and‌ ‌requirements‌ ‌that‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌met‌ ‌in‌ ‌order‌ ‌to‌ ‌issue‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit‌. c) The‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌service‌ ‌may‌ ‌issue‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit‌ ‌for‌ ‌one‌ ‌type‌ ‌of‌ ‌animal‌ ‌or‌ ‌multiple‌ ‌types‌ ‌of‌ ‌animals‌. d) A‌ ‌person‌ ‌must‌ ‌display‌ ‌their‌ ‌permit‌ ‌to‌ ‌a‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌warden‌ ‌upon‌ ‌request.‌ A violation of 13(02) is an Infraction . Enforcing‌ ‌Wardens‌ ‌Discretion‌ ‌if‌ ‌the‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌equipment,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌hunted‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌are‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌.‌ ‌Revocation‌ ‌of‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌permits‌ ‌at‌ ‌the‌ ‌discretion‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌primary‌ ‌Fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌Game‌ ‌Warden.‌ $300
docs.title: 13(02)‌. Hunting‌ ‌Permits‌

docs.text: No person shall **** a) Kill‌ ‌or‌ ‌attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌kill‌ ‌an‌ ‌animal‌ ‌in‌ ‌excess‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌limits‌ ‌listed‌ ‌below‌ * i) * Boar 1) No Limit ii) Coyote 1) No Limit iii) Crow 1) No Limit iv) Deer 1) Antlered‌ ‌Buck‌ ‌Deer:‌ ‌One‌ ‌per‌ ‌Tag,‌ ‌One‌ ‌per‌ ‌Day,‌ ‌Three‌ ‌per‌ ‌Year‌ 2) Antlerless‌ ‌Deer:‌ ‌One‌ ‌per‌ ‌Tag,‌ ‌One‌ ‌per‌ ‌Day,‌ ‌Two‌ ‌per‌ ‌Year‌ v) Mountain Lions 1) 1‌ ‌Per‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌/‌ ‌Tag‌ ‌Issued‌ vi) Pigeon 1) 2‌ ‌per‌ ‌day,‌ ‌6‌ ‌total‌ ‌in‌ ‌possession‌ vii) Rabbit 1) 10‌ ‌per‌ ‌day,‌ ‌30‌ ‌total‌ ‌in‌ ‌possession‌ viii) Clams 1) Size‌ ‌Requirement:‌ ‌Minimum‌ ‌height‌ ‌of‌ ‌1”‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌50‌ ‌Commercial:‌ ‌No‌ ‌Limit‌ ix) Crappie & Sunfish 1) Size‌ ‌Requirements:‌ ‌Minimum‌ ‌Length‌ ‌of‌ ‌10”‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌25‌ x) Black Bass 1) Size‌ ‌Requirements:‌ ‌None‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌5‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌300‌ ‌Pounds‌ ‌(136kg)‌ xi) White Bass 1) Size‌ ‌Requirements:‌ ‌None‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌No‌ ‌Limit‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌No‌ ‌Limit‌ xii) Striped Bass 1) Size‌ ‌Requirements:‌ ‌28”‌ ‌-‌ ‌43”‌ ‌in‌ ‌Length‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌2‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌15‌ xiii) Perch 1) Size‌ ‌Requirement:‌ ‌None‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌45‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌No‌ ‌Limit‌ xiv) White‌ ‌Sturgeon‌ 1) Size‌ ‌Requirements:‌ ‌4”‌ ‌-‌ ‌60”‌ ‌in‌ ‌Length‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌1‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌Prohibited‌ xv) Halibut‌ 1) Size‌ ‌Requirement:‌ ‌Minimum‌ ‌Length‌ ‌of‌ ‌22”‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌3‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌Prohibited‌ xvi) Salmon‌ 1) Size‌ ‌Requirement:‌ ‌None‌ Recreational:‌ ‌5‌ 2) Commercial:‌ ‌No‌ ‌Limit‌ xvii) Tilapia‌ 1) Size‌ ‌Requirement:‌ ‌None‌ 2) Recreational:‌ ‌No‌ ‌limit‌ 3) Commercial:‌ ‌No‌ ‌Limit‌ A violation of 13(03) ‌is‌ ‌an‌ ‌‌ Infraction‌ .‌ ‌ Relevant‌ ‌game‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌equipment‌ ‌may‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌ ‌at‌ ‌the‌ ‌discretion‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌law‌ ‌enforcement‌ ‌officer.‌ ‌ $300
docs.title: 13(03). Daily‌ ‌Limits‌ ‌and‌ ‌Possession‌ ‌Limits‌

docs.text: No person shall a) Possess‌‌ ‌or‌ ‌take‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌field‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌three‌ ‌times‌ ‌the‌ ‌daily‌ ‌bag‌ ‌limit,‌ ‌or‌ ‌who‌ ‌illegally‌ ‌‌possesses‌‌ ‌more‌ ‌than‌ ‌three‌ ‌times‌ ‌the‌ ‌legal‌ ‌‌possession‌‌ ‌limit‌ ‌is‌ ‌in‌ ‌violation‌. ‌ A violation of 13(04) is a Misdemeanor . Enforcing‌ ‌Wardens‌ ‌must‌ ‌seize‌ ‌the‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌equipment,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌hunted‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game.‌ 4 Months

docs.text: No person shall a) Attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌or‌ ‌successfully‌ ‌hunt,‌ ‌capture,‌ ‌bait,‌ ‌or‌ ‌lure‌ ‌any‌ ‌between‌ ‌the‌ ‌hours‌ ‌of‌ ‌‌sunset‌‌ ‌and‌ ‌‌sunrise‌.‌ A violation of 13(05) ‌is‌ ‌an‌ ‌‌ Infraction‌ .‌ ‌ $120
docs.title: 13(05) Hunting‌ ‌Hours

docs.text: a) **** Hunt‌ ‌with‌ ‌firearms‌ ‌that‌ ‌do‌ ‌not‌ ‌meet‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌firearm‌ ‌or‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌types: i) ‌bolt‌ ‌action,‌ ‌or‌ ‌semi-automatic‌ ‌rifle.‌ ii) Shotguns‌ ‌that‌ ‌fire‌ ‌as‌ ‌semi-automatic‌ ; or b) use‌ ‌a‌ ‌melee‌ ‌weaponry‌ ‌(e.g.‌ ‌bats,‌ ‌knives,‌ ‌axes,‌ ‌and‌ ‌so‌ ‌forth)‌ ‌for‌ ‌hunting;‌ ‌or‌ ‌ c) use‌ ‌poison‌ ‌for‌ ‌hunting;‌ ‌or‌ d) Hunt‌ ‌for‌ ‌aquatic‌ ‌species‌ ‌in‌ ‌manners‌ ‌other‌ ‌than‌ ‌with‌ ‌use‌ ‌of‌ ‌rod‌ ‌and‌ ‌reel,‌ ‌a‌ ‌spear,‌ ‌or‌ ‌a‌ ‌net‌ ‌unless‌ ‌licensed‌ ‌for‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌fishing‌ ‌by‌ ‌the‌ ‌State‌ ‌of‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas;‌ ‌or‌ e) Hold‌ ‌a‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌fishing‌ ‌license‌ ‌and‌ ‌fail‌ ‌to‌ ‌comply‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌standards‌ ‌when‌ ‌using‌ ‌nets‌ ‌or‌ ‌cages:‌ ‌ i) Any‌ ‌nets‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌cages‌ ‌used‌ ‌for‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌fishing‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌made‌ ‌of‌ ‌a‌ ‌biodegradable‌ ‌material‌ ‌so‌ ‌that‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌event‌ ‌of‌ ‌its ‌disconnection‌ ‌from‌ ‌the‌ ‌fish‌ ‌vessel,‌ ‌it‌ ‌will‌ ‌not‌ ‌cause‌ ‌long-term,‌ ‌adverse‌ ‌effect‌ ‌to‌ ‌marine‌ ‌life‌ ‌and‌ ‌public‌ ‌health.‌ A‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌13(06)‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌ Misdemeanor‌ .‌ ‌ Enforcing‌ ‌Wardens‌ ‌Discretion‌ ‌if‌ ‌the‌ ‌hunting‌ ‌equipment,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌hunted‌ ‌fish‌ ‌and‌ ‌game‌ ‌are‌‌ to‌ ‌be‌ ‌seized‌.‌ ‌ 4 Months
