docs.text: Any individual while occupying motor vehicle must a) wear a seatbelt any time the motor vehicle is in motion b) insure all other occupants of the motor vehicle is following 8(52)a \ A violation of 8(52) is an Infraction $150

docs.text: Title 9 - Control of Deadly Weapons and Equipment 9(01).‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Certificate‌ ‌and‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌Violation‌ ‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌License‌ ‌and‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌Violation‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Obtain‌ ‌a‌ ‌firearms‌ ‌permit‌ ‌or‌ ‌a‌ ‌concealed‌ ‌carry‌ ‌permit‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌a‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Safety‌ ‌Certificate‌ ‌(FSC);‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Obtain‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌while‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌set‌ ‌age‌ ‌limit:‌\ **** i) Nobody‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌age‌ ‌of‌ ‌21‌ ‌can‌ ‌hold‌ ‌a‌ ‌Concealed‌ ‌Carry‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌(CCP)‌ ‌for‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌handgun‌.‌\ ii) Nobody‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌age‌ ‌of‌ ‌18‌ ‌can‌ ‌hold‌ ‌a‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌for‌ ‌any‌ ‌‌firearm‌.‌ ‌;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ c) Conceal‌ ‌Carry‌ ‌a‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌a‌ ‌CCP;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ d) Carry‌ ‌or‌ ‌‌possess‌‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌a‌ ‌firearm‌ ‌permit.‌\ \ A Violation of 9(01). is a Misdemeanor 10 Months 9(02).‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Age‌ ‌Restrictions‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Age‌ ‌Restrictions‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Carry‌ ‌or‌ ‌‌possess‌‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌while‌ ‌they‌ ‌are‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌age‌ ‌of‌ ‌18‌\ i) Exception:‌\ 1) They‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌on‌ ‌private‌ ‌‌property‌;‌ ‌and‌ ‌\ 2) They‌ ‌must‌ ‌have‌ ‌permission‌ ‌from‌ ‌their‌ ‌parent/guardian;‌ ‌and‌ ‌\ 3) They‌ ‌are‌ ‌accompanied‌ ‌by‌ ‌the‌ ‌owner‌ ‌for‌ ‌whom‌ ‌the‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌is‌ ‌registered‌ ‌to‌ ‌at‌ ‌all‌ ‌times.‌\ ii) The‌ ‌above‌ ‌exception‌ ‌does‌ ‌not‌ ‌mean‌ ‌they‌ ‌are‌ ‌given‌ ‌a‌ ‌free‌ ‌pass‌ ‌to‌ ‌shoot/handle‌ ‌the‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌as‌ ‌they‌ ‌wish.‌ ‌Other‌ ‌laws‌ ‌such‌ ‌as‌ ‌‌9(06).‌ ‌Weapons‌ ‌Discharge‌ ‌Violation‌‌ ‌should‌ ‌be‌ ‌prosecuted‌ ‌accordingly.‌\ b) Conceal‌ ‌Carry‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌while‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌age‌ ‌of‌ ‌21.‌\ \ A violation of 9(02). is a Misdemeanor 10 Months 9(03).‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Carry‌ ‌Violation‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Carry‌ ‌Violation‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Carrying ‌a‌ ‌‌handgun‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ ‌Carry‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌in‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas;‌ ‌or‌ \ b) Possess‌‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌when‌ ‌they‌ ‌have‌ ‌committed‌ ‌a‌ ‌prior‌ ‌felony,‌ ‌regardless‌ ‌of‌ ‌whether‌ ‌or‌ ‌not‌ ‌they‌ ‌have‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ d) Possess‌‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌government‌ ‌owned‌ ‌building.‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 9(03). is a Misdemeanor 10 Months 9(04).‌ ‌Possession‌ ‌of‌ ‌an‌ ‌Illegal‌ ‌Weapon‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Possession‌ ‌of‌ ‌an‌ ‌Illegal‌ ‌Weapon‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Manufacture,‌ ‌create,‌ ‌sell,‌ ‌or‌ ‌‌possess‌‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌items:‌ ‌\ i) Metal‌ ‌knuckles‌ ‌\ ii) Switchblades‌ ‌\ 1) Which‌ ‌are‌ ‌defined‌ ‌by‌ ‌any‌ ‌folding‌ ‌or‌ ‌retractable‌ ‌knife‌ ‌or‌ ‌blade‌ ‌is‌ ‌longer‌ ‌than‌ ‌3‌ ‌inches‌ ‌which‌ ‌can‌ ‌be‌ ‌opened‌ ‌automatically.‌ ‌Automatically‌ ‌meaning‌ ‌by‌ ‌mechanism,‌ ‌spring,‌ ‌flick‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌wrist,‌ ‌gravity,‌ ‌etc;‌ ‌which‌ ‌allows‌ ‌the‌ ‌knife‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌opened‌ ‌quickly‌ ‌with‌ ‌one‌ ‌hand.‌ ‌\ iii) Misleading‌ ‌Knives‌\ 1) Any‌ ‌knife‌ ‌or‌ ‌blade‌ ‌that‌ ‌is‌ ‌hidden‌ ‌inside‌ ‌or‌ ‌otherwise‌ ‌disguised‌ ‌as‌ ‌something‌ ‌else‌ ‌is‌ ‌considered‌ ‌a‌ ‌misleading‌ ‌knife.‌ ‌Lipstick‌ ‌knives,‌ ‌pen‌ ‌knives,‌ ‌umbrella‌ ‌handle‌ ‌knives,‌ ‌comb‌ ‌knives,‌ ‌etc‌; ‌are‌ ‌examples‌ ‌of‌ ‌misleading‌ ‌knives‌ ‌\ iv) Daggers,‌ ‌Stilettos,‌ ‌Dirks,‌ ‌Ballistic‌ ‌Knives‌ ‌\ 1) These‌ ‌knives‌ ‌and‌ ‌any‌ ‌other‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌that‌ ‌cannot‌ ‌serve‌ ‌as‌ ‌tools,‌ ‌lacking‌ ‌a‌ ‌cutting‌ ‌edge‌ ‌and‌ ‌can‌ ‌only‌ ‌be‌ ‌used‌ ‌for‌ ‌piercing‌ ‌and‌ ‌stabbing‌ ‌\ v) Any‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌that‌ ‌is‌ ‌not‌ ‌registered‌\ vi) Any‌ ‌firearm‌ ‌that‌ ‌has‌ ‌the‌ ‌serial‌ ‌number‌ ‌scratched‌ ‌off‌ ‌\ vii) The‌ ‌following‌ ‌fully‌ ‌automatic‌ ‌Assault‌ ‌Rifles‌ ‌\ 1) Bullpup‌ ‌Rifle‌ ‌and‌ ‌Mk‌ ‌II‌ ‌\ 2) Compact‌ ‌rifle‌ ‌\ viii) The‌ ‌following‌ ‌Shotguns‌ ‌\ 1) Assault‌ ‌Shotgun‌\ 2) Heavy‌ ‌Shotgun‌ ‌\ 3) Sawed-Off‌ ‌Shotgun‌ ‌\ 4) Sweeper‌ ‌Shotgun‌ ‌\ ix) The‌ ‌following‌ ‌Machine‌ ‌Guns‌ ‌\ 1) Combat‌ ‌MG‌ ‌\ 2) Combat‌ ‌MG‌ ‌Ml‌ ‌II‌ ‌\ 3) Gusenberg‌ ‌Sweeper‌ ‌\ 4) Machine‌ ‌Pistol‌ ‌\ 5) Micro‌ ‌SMG‌ ‌\ 6) Mini‌ ‌SMG‌ ‌\ 7) SMG‌ ‌Mk‌ ‌II‌ ‌\ x) The‌ ‌following‌ ‌Heavy‌ ‌Weapons‌ ‌\ 1) Minigun‌ ‌ ‌\ 2) Firework‌ ‌Launcher\ a) Except‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌proper‌ ‌permit‌ ‌given‌ ‌by‌ ‌the‌ ‌Los‌ ‌Santos‌ ‌Fire‌ ‌Department.‌ ‌\ xi) Suppressors‌ ‌\ xii) A‌ ‌bullet‌ ‌containing‌ ‌any‌ ‌explosive‌ ‌agent‌ ‌\ xiii) A‌ ‌concealed‌ ‌explosive‌ ‌substance‌ ‌\ xiv) Grenades‌ ‌or‌ ‌any‌ ‌form‌ ‌of‌ ‌explosives.‌ ‌\ 1) This‌ ‌excludes‌ ‌fireworks‌ ‌and‌ ‌flares.‌ ‌For‌ ‌regulations‌ ‌on‌ ‌fireworks,‌ ‌reference‌ ‌‌14(02).‌ ‌\ \ This‌ ‌crime‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌ Misdemeanor‌‌ ‌when‌ ‌there‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌9(04)i,‌ ‌9(04)ii,‌ ‌9(04)iii,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌9(04)iv.‌ ‌ \ This‌ ‌crime‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌ Felony‌‌ ‌‌when‌ ‌there‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌9(04)v,‌ ‌9(04)vi,‌ ‌9(04)vii,‌ ‌9(04)viii,‌ ‌ 9(04)ix,‌ ‌9(04)x,‌ ‌9(04)xi,‌ ‌9(04)xii,‌ ‌9(04)xiii,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌9(04)xiv.‌ ‌ \ \ (OOC‌ ‌note)‌ ‌If‌ ‌a‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌is‌ ‌listed‌ ‌as‌ ‌an‌ ‌illegal‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌you‌ ‌can‌ ‌still‌ ‌use‌ ‌it‌ ‌as‌ ‌long‌ ‌as‌ ‌your‌ civilian‌ ‌contact‌ ‌level‌ ‌permits‌ ‌that‌ ‌weapons‌ ‌usage.‌ ‌However,‌ ‌if‌ ‌you‌ ‌are‌ ‌stopped‌ ‌by‌ ‌law ‌enforcement‌ ‌you‌ ‌may‌ ‌be‌ ‌arrested‌ ‌for‌ ‌possession‌ ‌of‌ ‌an‌ ‌illegal‌ ‌weapon.‌ 10 Months 15 Months 9(05).‌ ‌Brandishing‌ ‌a‌ ‌Firearm‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Brandishing‌ ‌a‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Point,‌ ‌hold,‌ ‌openly‌ ‌carry‌ ‌or‌ ‌brandish‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌,‌ ‌air‌ ‌or‌ ‌gas-operated‌ ‌weapon,‌ ‌or‌ ‌object‌ ‌that‌ ‌appears‌ ‌like‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌proper‌ ‌toy‌ ‌and‌ ‌prop‌ ‌identification‌ ‌in‌ ‌an‌ ‌attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌elicit‌ ‌fear‌ ‌or‌ ‌hysteria;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Hold‌ ‌an‌ ‌object‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌manner‌ ‌similar‌ ‌to‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌who‌ ‌attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌elicit‌ ‌the‌ ‌same‌ ‌fear‌ ‌or‌ ‌response‌ ‌as‌ ‌brandishing‌ ‌an‌ ‌actual‌ ‌‌firearm‌.‌\ \ A‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌9(05)‌. ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌ Felony‌ 13 Months 9(06).‌ ‌Weapons‌ ‌Discharge‌ ‌Violation‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Weapons‌ ‌Discharge‌ ‌Violation‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Willfully‌ ‌fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌grossly‌ ‌negligent‌ ‌manner‌ ‌which‌ ‌could‌ ‌result‌ ‌in‌ ‌injury‌ ‌or‌ ‌death;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Fire‌ ‌at‌ ‌a‌ ‌building,‌ ‌car,‌ ‌aircraft,‌ ‌or‌ ‌camper;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ c) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌‌city‌ ‌limits‌;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ d) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌over‌ ‌any‌ ‌road‌ ‌or‌ ‌trail;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ e) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌within‌ ‌150‌ ‌yards‌ ‌of‌ ‌a‌ ‌building,‌ ‌car,‌ ‌aircraft,‌ ‌or‌ ‌camper‌ ‌that‌ ‌is‌ ‌not‌ ‌your‌ ‌own;‌ ‌or‌\ f) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌national‌ ‌park;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ g) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌within‌ ‌150‌ ‌yards‌ ‌of‌ ‌a‌ ‌National‌ ‌Park‌\ \ A violation of 9(06). is a Misdemeanor 8 Months 9(07).‌ ‌Drive-By‌ ‌Shooting‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Drive-By‌ ‌Shooting‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Drive‌‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌vehicle‌,‌ ‌whether‌ ‌on‌ ‌land,‌ ‌sea‌ ‌or‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌air,‌ ‌and‌ ‌has‌ ‌a‌ ‌passenger‌ ‌who‌ ‌they‌ ‌knowingly‌ ‌and‌ ‌willingly‌ ‌let‌ ‌discharge‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌from‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌‌vehicle‌,‌ ‌and‌ ‌the‌ ‌passenger‌ ‌is‌ ‌not‌ ‌an‌ ‌on-duty‌ ‌peace‌ ‌officer;‌ ‌or‌ ‌ \ b) Discharge‌ ‌a‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌whether‌ ‌on‌ ‌land,‌ ‌sea‌ ‌or‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌air,‌ ‌and‌ ‌is‌ ‌not‌ ‌an‌ ‌on-duty‌ ‌peace‌ ‌officer‌ ‌without‌ ‌proper‌ ‌authorization‌\ \ A‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌9(07)‌. ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌ Felony 15 Months 9(08).‌ ‌Illegal‌ ‌Sale‌ ‌of‌ ‌a‌ ‌Firearm A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Illegal‌ ‌Sale‌ ‌of‌ ‌a‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) ell‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌the‌ ‌appropriate‌ ‌State‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌License‌ ‌to‌ ‌sell‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Sell‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌complying‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌regulations:‌ ‌\ i) Private‌ ‌sales‌ ‌are‌ ‌not‌ ‌required‌ ‌to‌ ‌have‌ ‌a‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌firearms‌ ‌License‌ ‌to‌ ‌sell,‌ ‌but‌ ‌all‌ ‌private‌ ‌sales‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌conducted‌ ‌through‌ ‌a‌ ‌licensed‌ ‌dealer,‌ ‌who‌ ‌is‌ ‌to‌ ‌keep‌ ‌a‌ ‌record‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌sale‌ ‌and‌ ‌conduct‌ ‌a‌ ‌background‌ ‌check‌ ‌\ ii) The‌ ‌Customer‌ ‌must‌ ‌already‌ ‌have‌ ‌a‌ ‌FSC‌\ \ A violation of 9(08). is a Misdemeanor 10 Months 9(09).‌ ‌Toy‌ ‌and‌ ‌Mock‌ ‌Weapon‌ ‌Violations‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Toy‌ ‌and‌ ‌Mock ‌Weapon‌ ‌Violations‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌a‌ ‌toy,‌ ‌mock,‌ ‌fake,‌ ‌legitimate‌ ‌or‌ ‌imitation‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌that‌ ‌does‌ ‌or‌ ‌does‌ ‌not‌ ‌fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌paintball‌ ‌pellet‌ ‌or‌ ‌BB‌ ‌round‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌the‌ ‌appropriate‌ ‌federally‌ ‌mandated‌ ‌markings;‌ ‌ ‌\ i) The‌ ‌Department‌ ‌of‌ ‌Commerce‌ ‌requires‌ ‌all‌ ‌mock/‌ ‌imitation‌ ‌weapons‌ ‌that‌ ‌fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌paintball‌ ‌pellet‌ ‌or‌ ‌BB‌ ‌round‌ ‌to‌ ‌have‌ ‌a‌ ‌round‌ ‌orange‌ ‌tip‌ ‌or‌ ‌circle‌ ‌on‌ ‌the‌ ‌barrel‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌indicating‌ ‌the‌ ‌nature‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌weapon.‌ ‌In‌ ‌cases‌ ‌where‌ ‌the‌ ‌barrel‌ ‌doesn’t‌ ‌have‌ ‌an‌ ‌orange‌ ‌tip‌ ‌or‌ ‌circle,‌ ‌it‌ ‌must‌ ‌have‌ ‌an‌ ‌orange‌ ‌barrel‌ ‌plug‌ ‌over‌ ‌it‌ ‌when‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌public‌ ‌space.‌ ‌\ ii) If‌ ‌the‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌long‌ ‌gun‌ ‌or‌ ‌rifle‌ ‌the‌ ‌ammunition‌ ‌magazine‌ ‌/‌ ‌clip‌ ‌and‌ ‌buttstock‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌colored‌ ‌orange‌ ‌or‌ ‌a‌ ‌high‌ ‌neon‌ ‌color‌ ‌such‌ ‌as‌ ‌orange,‌ ‌yellow,‌ ‌or‌ ‌pink.‌ ‌;‌ ‌or‌\ b) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌toy,‌ ‌mock,‌ ‌fake,‌ ‌legitimate‌ ‌or‌ ‌imitation‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌that‌ ‌fires‌ ‌a‌ ‌paintball‌ ‌pellet‌ ‌or‌ ‌BB‌ ‌round‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌grossly‌ ‌negligent‌ ‌manner‌ ‌which‌ ‌could‌ ‌result‌ ‌in‌ ‌injury‌ ‌or‌ ‌death;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ c) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌toy,‌ ‌mock,‌ ‌fake,‌ ‌legitimate‌ ‌or‌ ‌imitation‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌that‌ ‌fires‌ ‌a‌ ‌paintball‌ ‌pellet‌ ‌or‌ ‌BB‌ ‌round‌ ‌at‌ ‌or‌ ‌from‌ ‌a‌ ‌building,‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌or‌ ‌aircraft;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ d) Use‌ ‌a‌ ‌toy,‌ ‌mock,‌ ‌fake,‌ ‌legitimate‌ ‌or‌ ‌imitation‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌while‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌act‌ ‌of‌ ‌another‌‌ Misdemeanor‌ ‌ ‌ A violation of 9(09). is a Misdemeanor 10 Months 9(10).‌ ‌Transportation‌ ‌of‌ ‌Firearms‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Transportation‌ ‌of‌ ‌Firearms‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Transport‌ ‌a‌ ‌loaded‌ ‌firearm‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌vehicle‌ ‌\ i) Exceptions:‌ ‌\ 1) The‌ ‌firearm‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌handgun‌‌ ‌for‌ ‌which‌ ‌the‌ ‌person‌ ‌has‌ ‌a‌ ‌concealed‌ ‌carry‌ ‌permit‌ ‌for‌\ \ A‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌9(10)‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌‌ Misdemeanor‌‌ ‌ 5 Months 9(11).‌ ‌Transportation‌ ‌of‌ ‌Firearms‌ ‌for‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Purposes‌ A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Transportation‌ ‌of‌ ‌Firearms‌ ‌for‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Purposes‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Transport‌ ‌‌firearms‌‌ ‌for‌ ‌a‌ ‌legal‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌sale‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ ‌Sale‌ ‌permit‌ ‌and‌ ‌a‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Firearms‌ ‌transportation‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌\ i) In‌ ‌order‌ ‌for‌ ‌it‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌considered‌ ‌a‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌sale,‌ ‌one‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌true:‌\ 1) The‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌is‌ ‌registered‌ ‌to‌ ‌a‌ ‌business‌ ‌or‌ ‌gun‌ ‌dealership‌ ‌\ 2) A‌ ‌business‌ ‌funded‌ ‌the‌ ‌purchase‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌‌firearms‌‌ ‌the‌ ‌person‌ ‌is‌ ‌now‌ ‌selling.‌ ‌\ 3) The‌ ‌funds‌ ‌made‌ ‌from‌ ‌the‌ ‌sale‌ ‌will‌ ‌go‌ ‌to‌ ‌a‌ ‌business.‌\ b) All‌ ‌‌firearms‌‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌unloaded‌ ‌during‌ ‌transport.‌\ \ A violation of 9(11). is a Felony \ \ When‌ ‌transporting‌ ‌your‌ ‌own‌ ‌firearms‌ ‌you‌ ‌are‌ ‌not‌ ‌required‌ ‌to‌ ‌have‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit‌ 17 Months

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌License‌ ‌and‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌Violation‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Obtain‌ ‌a‌ ‌firearms‌ ‌permit‌ ‌or‌ ‌a‌ ‌concealed‌ ‌carry‌ ‌permit‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌a‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Safety‌ ‌Certificate‌ ‌(FSC);‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Obtain‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌while‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌set‌ ‌age‌ ‌limit:‌\ **** i) Nobody‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌age‌ ‌of‌ ‌21‌ ‌can‌ ‌hold‌ ‌a‌ ‌Concealed‌ ‌Carry‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌(CCP)‌ ‌for‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌handgun‌.‌\ ii) Nobody‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌age‌ ‌of‌ ‌18‌ ‌can‌ ‌hold‌ ‌a‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌for‌ ‌any‌ ‌‌firearm‌.‌ ‌;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ c) Conceal‌ ‌Carry‌ ‌a‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌a‌ ‌CCP;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ d) Carry‌ ‌or‌ ‌‌possess‌‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌a‌ ‌firearm‌ ‌permit.‌\ \ A Violation of 9(01). is a Misdemeanor 10 Months
docs.title: 9(01).‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Certificate‌ ‌and‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌Violation‌ ‌

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Age‌ ‌Restrictions‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Carry‌ ‌or‌ ‌‌possess‌‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌while‌ ‌they‌ ‌are‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌age‌ ‌of‌ ‌18‌\ i) Exception:‌\ 1) They‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌on‌ ‌private‌ ‌‌property‌;‌ ‌and‌ ‌\ 2) They‌ ‌must‌ ‌have‌ ‌permission‌ ‌from‌ ‌their‌ ‌parent/guardian;‌ ‌and‌ ‌\ 3) They‌ ‌are‌ ‌accompanied‌ ‌by‌ ‌the‌ ‌owner‌ ‌for‌ ‌whom‌ ‌the‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌is‌ ‌registered‌ ‌to‌ ‌at‌ ‌all‌ ‌times.‌\ ii) The‌ ‌above‌ ‌exception‌ ‌does‌ ‌not‌ ‌mean‌ ‌they‌ ‌are‌ ‌given‌ ‌a‌ ‌free‌ ‌pass‌ ‌to‌ ‌shoot/handle‌ ‌the‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌as‌ ‌they‌ ‌wish.‌ ‌Other‌ ‌laws‌ ‌such‌ ‌as‌ ‌‌9(06).‌ ‌Weapons‌ ‌Discharge‌ ‌Violation‌‌ ‌should‌ ‌be‌ ‌prosecuted‌ ‌accordingly.‌\ b) Conceal‌ ‌Carry‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌while‌ ‌under‌ ‌the‌ ‌age‌ ‌of‌ ‌21.‌\ \ A violation of 9(02). is a Misdemeanor 10 Months
docs.title: 9(02).‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Age‌ ‌Restrictions‌

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌Carry‌ ‌Violation‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Carrying ‌a‌ ‌‌handgun‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ ‌Carry‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌in‌ ‌San‌ ‌Andreas;‌ ‌or‌ \ b) Possess‌‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌when‌ ‌they‌ ‌have‌ ‌committed‌ ‌a‌ ‌prior‌ ‌felony,‌ ‌regardless‌ ‌of‌ ‌whether‌ ‌or‌ ‌not‌ ‌they‌ ‌have‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ d) Possess‌‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌government‌ ‌owned‌ ‌building.‌ ‌\ \ A violation of 9(03). is a Misdemeanor 10 Months

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Possession‌ ‌of‌ ‌an‌ ‌Illegal‌ ‌Weapon‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Manufacture,‌ ‌create,‌ ‌sell,‌ ‌or‌ ‌‌possess‌‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌items:‌ ‌\ i) Metal‌ ‌knuckles‌ ‌\ ii) Switchblades‌ ‌\ 1) Which‌ ‌are‌ ‌defined‌ ‌by‌ ‌any‌ ‌folding‌ ‌or‌ ‌retractable‌ ‌knife‌ ‌or‌ ‌blade‌ ‌is‌ ‌longer‌ ‌than‌ ‌3‌ ‌inches‌ ‌which‌ ‌can‌ ‌be‌ ‌opened‌ ‌automatically.‌ ‌Automatically‌ ‌meaning‌ ‌by‌ ‌mechanism,‌ ‌spring,‌ ‌flick‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌wrist,‌ ‌gravity,‌ ‌etc;‌ ‌which‌ ‌allows‌ ‌the‌ ‌knife‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌opened‌ ‌quickly‌ ‌with‌ ‌one‌ ‌hand.‌ ‌\ iii) Misleading‌ ‌Knives‌\ 1) Any‌ ‌knife‌ ‌or‌ ‌blade‌ ‌that‌ ‌is‌ ‌hidden‌ ‌inside‌ ‌or‌ ‌otherwise‌ ‌disguised‌ ‌as‌ ‌something‌ ‌else‌ ‌is‌ ‌considered‌ ‌a‌ ‌misleading‌ ‌knife.‌ ‌Lipstick‌ ‌knives,‌ ‌pen‌ ‌knives,‌ ‌umbrella‌ ‌handle‌ ‌knives,‌ ‌comb‌ ‌knives,‌ ‌etc‌; ‌are‌ ‌examples‌ ‌of‌ ‌misleading‌ ‌knives‌ ‌\ iv) Daggers,‌ ‌Stilettos,‌ ‌Dirks,‌ ‌Ballistic‌ ‌Knives‌ ‌\ 1) These‌ ‌knives‌ ‌and‌ ‌any‌ ‌other‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌that‌ ‌cannot‌ ‌serve‌ ‌as‌ ‌tools,‌ ‌lacking‌ ‌a‌ ‌cutting‌ ‌edge‌ ‌and‌ ‌can‌ ‌only‌ ‌be‌ ‌used‌ ‌for‌ ‌piercing‌ ‌and‌ ‌stabbing‌ ‌\ v) Any‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌that‌ ‌is‌ ‌not‌ ‌registered‌\ vi) Any‌ ‌firearm‌ ‌that‌ ‌has‌ ‌the‌ ‌serial‌ ‌number‌ ‌scratched‌ ‌off‌ ‌\ vii) The‌ ‌following‌ ‌fully‌ ‌automatic‌ ‌Assault‌ ‌Rifles‌ ‌\ 1) Bullpup‌ ‌Rifle‌ ‌and‌ ‌Mk‌ ‌II‌ ‌\ 2) Compact‌ ‌rifle‌ ‌\ viii) The‌ ‌following‌ ‌Shotguns‌ ‌\ 1) Assault‌ ‌Shotgun‌\ 2) Heavy‌ ‌Shotgun‌ ‌\ 3) Sawed-Off‌ ‌Shotgun‌ ‌\ 4) Sweeper‌ ‌Shotgun‌ ‌\ ix) The‌ ‌following‌ ‌Machine‌ ‌Guns‌ ‌\ 1) Combat‌ ‌MG‌ ‌\ 2) Combat‌ ‌MG‌ ‌Ml‌ ‌II‌ ‌\ 3) Gusenberg‌ ‌Sweeper‌ ‌\ 4) Machine‌ ‌Pistol‌ ‌\ 5) Micro‌ ‌SMG‌ ‌\ 6) Mini‌ ‌SMG‌ ‌\ 7) SMG‌ ‌Mk‌ ‌II‌ ‌\ x) The‌ ‌following‌ ‌Heavy‌ ‌Weapons‌ ‌\ 1) Minigun‌ ‌ ‌\ 2) Firework‌ ‌Launcher\ a) Except‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌proper‌ ‌permit‌ ‌given‌ ‌by‌ ‌the‌ ‌Los‌ ‌Santos‌ ‌Fire‌ ‌Department.‌ ‌\ xi) Suppressors‌ ‌\ xii) A‌ ‌bullet‌ ‌containing‌ ‌any‌ ‌explosive‌ ‌agent‌ ‌\ xiii) A‌ ‌concealed‌ ‌explosive‌ ‌substance‌ ‌\ xiv) Grenades‌ ‌or‌ ‌any‌ ‌form‌ ‌of‌ ‌explosives.‌ ‌\ 1) This‌ ‌excludes‌ ‌fireworks‌ ‌and‌ ‌flares.‌ ‌For‌ ‌regulations‌ ‌on‌ ‌fireworks,‌ ‌reference‌ ‌‌14(02).‌ ‌\ \ This‌ ‌crime‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌ Misdemeanor‌‌ ‌when‌ ‌there‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌9(04)i,‌ ‌9(04)ii,‌ ‌9(04)iii,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌9(04)iv.‌ ‌ \ This‌ ‌crime‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌ Felony‌‌ ‌‌when‌ ‌there‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌9(04)v,‌ ‌9(04)vi,‌ ‌9(04)vii,‌ ‌9(04)viii,‌ ‌ 9(04)ix,‌ ‌9(04)x,‌ ‌9(04)xi,‌ ‌9(04)xii,‌ ‌9(04)xiii,‌ ‌and/or‌ ‌9(04)xiv.‌ ‌ \ \ (OOC‌ ‌note)‌ ‌If‌ ‌a‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌is‌ ‌listed‌ ‌as‌ ‌an‌ ‌illegal‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌you‌ ‌can‌ ‌still‌ ‌use‌ ‌it‌ ‌as‌ ‌long‌ ‌as‌ ‌your‌ civilian‌ ‌contact‌ ‌level‌ ‌permits‌ ‌that‌ ‌weapons‌ ‌usage.‌ ‌However,‌ ‌if‌ ‌you‌ ‌are‌ ‌stopped‌ ‌by‌ ‌law ‌enforcement‌ ‌you‌ ‌may‌ ‌be‌ ‌arrested‌ ‌for‌ ‌possession‌ ‌of‌ ‌an‌ ‌illegal‌ ‌weapon.‌ 10 Months 15 Months
docs.title: 9(04).‌ ‌Possession‌ ‌of‌ ‌an‌ ‌Illegal‌ ‌Weapon‌

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Brandishing‌ ‌a‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Point,‌ ‌hold,‌ ‌openly‌ ‌carry‌ ‌or‌ ‌brandish‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌,‌ ‌air‌ ‌or‌ ‌gas-operated‌ ‌weapon,‌ ‌or‌ ‌object‌ ‌that‌ ‌appears‌ ‌like‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌proper‌ ‌toy‌ ‌and‌ ‌prop‌ ‌identification‌ ‌in‌ ‌an‌ ‌attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌elicit‌ ‌fear‌ ‌or‌ ‌hysteria;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Hold‌ ‌an‌ ‌object‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌manner‌ ‌similar‌ ‌to‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌who‌ ‌attempt‌ ‌to‌ ‌elicit‌ ‌the‌ ‌same‌ ‌fear‌ ‌or‌ ‌response‌ ‌as‌ ‌brandishing‌ ‌an‌ ‌actual‌ ‌‌firearm‌.‌\ \ A‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌9(05)‌. ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌ Felony‌ 13 Months
docs.title: 9(05).‌ ‌Brandishing‌ ‌a‌ ‌Firearm‌

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Weapons‌ ‌Discharge‌ ‌Violation‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Willfully‌ ‌fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌grossly‌ ‌negligent‌ ‌manner‌ ‌which‌ ‌could‌ ‌result‌ ‌in‌ ‌injury‌ ‌or‌ ‌death;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Fire‌ ‌at‌ ‌a‌ ‌building,‌ ‌car,‌ ‌aircraft,‌ ‌or‌ ‌camper;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ c) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌‌city‌ ‌limits‌;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ d) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌over‌ ‌any‌ ‌road‌ ‌or‌ ‌trail;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ e) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌within‌ ‌150‌ ‌yards‌ ‌of‌ ‌a‌ ‌building,‌ ‌car,‌ ‌aircraft,‌ ‌or‌ ‌camper‌ ‌that‌ ‌is‌ ‌not‌ ‌your‌ ‌own;‌ ‌or‌\ f) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌national‌ ‌park;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ g) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌within‌ ‌150‌ ‌yards‌ ‌of‌ ‌a‌ ‌National‌ ‌Park‌\ \ A violation of 9(06). is a Misdemeanor 8 Months
docs.title: 9(06).‌ ‌Weapons‌ ‌Discharge‌ ‌Violation‌

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Drive-By‌ ‌Shooting‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Drive‌‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌vehicle‌,‌ ‌whether‌ ‌on‌ ‌land,‌ ‌sea‌ ‌or‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌air,‌ ‌and‌ ‌has‌ ‌a‌ ‌passenger‌ ‌who‌ ‌they‌ ‌knowingly‌ ‌and‌ ‌willingly‌ ‌let‌ ‌discharge‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌from‌ ‌within‌ ‌the‌ ‌‌vehicle‌,‌ ‌and‌ ‌the‌ ‌passenger‌ ‌is‌ ‌not‌ ‌an‌ ‌on-duty‌ ‌peace‌ ‌officer;‌ ‌or‌ ‌ \ b) Discharge‌ ‌a‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌whether‌ ‌on‌ ‌land,‌ ‌sea‌ ‌or‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌air,‌ ‌and‌ ‌is‌ ‌not‌ ‌an‌ ‌on-duty‌ ‌peace‌ ‌officer‌ ‌without‌ ‌proper‌ ‌authorization‌\ \ A‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌9(07)‌. ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌ Felony 15 Months
docs.title: 9(07).‌ ‌Drive-By‌ ‌Shooting‌

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Illegal‌ ‌Sale‌ ‌of‌ ‌a‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) ell‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌the‌ ‌appropriate‌ ‌State‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Firearm‌ ‌License‌ ‌to‌ ‌sell‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ b) Sell‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌without‌ ‌complying‌ ‌with‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌regulations:‌ ‌\ i) Private‌ ‌sales‌ ‌are‌ ‌not‌ ‌required‌ ‌to‌ ‌have‌ ‌a‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌firearms‌ ‌License‌ ‌to‌ ‌sell,‌ ‌but‌ ‌all‌ ‌private‌ ‌sales‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌conducted‌ ‌through‌ ‌a‌ ‌licensed‌ ‌dealer,‌ ‌who‌ ‌is‌ ‌to‌ ‌keep‌ ‌a‌ ‌record‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌sale‌ ‌and‌ ‌conduct‌ ‌a‌ ‌background‌ ‌check‌ ‌\ ii) The‌ ‌Customer‌ ‌must‌ ‌already‌ ‌have‌ ‌a‌ ‌FSC‌\ \ A violation of 9(08). is a Misdemeanor 10 Months
docs.title: 9(08).‌ ‌Illegal‌ ‌Sale‌ ‌of‌ ‌a‌ ‌Firearm

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Toy‌ ‌and‌ ‌Mock ‌Weapon‌ ‌Violations‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Operate‌ ‌a‌ ‌toy,‌ ‌mock,‌ ‌fake,‌ ‌legitimate‌ ‌or‌ ‌imitation‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌that‌ ‌does‌ ‌or‌ ‌does‌ ‌not‌ ‌fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌paintball‌ ‌pellet‌ ‌or‌ ‌BB‌ ‌round‌ ‌without‌ ‌having‌ ‌the‌ ‌appropriate‌ ‌federally‌ ‌mandated‌ ‌markings;‌ ‌ ‌\ i) The‌ ‌Department‌ ‌of‌ ‌Commerce‌ ‌requires‌ ‌all‌ ‌mock/‌ ‌imitation‌ ‌weapons‌ ‌that‌ ‌fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌paintball‌ ‌pellet‌ ‌or‌ ‌BB‌ ‌round‌ ‌to‌ ‌have‌ ‌a‌ ‌round‌ ‌orange‌ ‌tip‌ ‌or‌ ‌circle‌ ‌on‌ ‌the‌ ‌barrel‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌indicating‌ ‌the‌ ‌nature‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌weapon.‌ ‌In‌ ‌cases‌ ‌where‌ ‌the‌ ‌barrel‌ ‌doesn’t‌ ‌have‌ ‌an‌ ‌orange‌ ‌tip‌ ‌or‌ ‌circle,‌ ‌it‌ ‌must‌ ‌have‌ ‌an‌ ‌orange‌ ‌barrel‌ ‌plug‌ ‌over‌ ‌it‌ ‌when‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌public‌ ‌space.‌ ‌\ ii) If‌ ‌the‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌long‌ ‌gun‌ ‌or‌ ‌rifle‌ ‌the‌ ‌ammunition‌ ‌magazine‌ ‌/‌ ‌clip‌ ‌and‌ ‌buttstock‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌colored‌ ‌orange‌ ‌or‌ ‌a‌ ‌high‌ ‌neon‌ ‌color‌ ‌such‌ ‌as‌ ‌orange,‌ ‌yellow,‌ ‌or‌ ‌pink.‌ ‌;‌ ‌or‌\ b) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌toy,‌ ‌mock,‌ ‌fake,‌ ‌legitimate‌ ‌or‌ ‌imitation‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌that‌ ‌fires‌ ‌a‌ ‌paintball‌ ‌pellet‌ ‌or‌ ‌BB‌ ‌round‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌grossly‌ ‌negligent‌ ‌manner‌ ‌which‌ ‌could‌ ‌result‌ ‌in‌ ‌injury‌ ‌or‌ ‌death;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ c) Fire‌ ‌a‌ ‌toy,‌ ‌mock,‌ ‌fake,‌ ‌legitimate‌ ‌or‌ ‌imitation‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌that‌ ‌fires‌ ‌a‌ ‌paintball‌ ‌pellet‌ ‌or‌ ‌BB‌ ‌round‌ ‌at‌ ‌or‌ ‌from‌ ‌a‌ ‌building,‌ ‌‌vehicle‌‌ ‌or‌ ‌aircraft;‌ ‌or‌ ‌\ d) Use‌ ‌a‌ ‌toy,‌ ‌mock,‌ ‌fake,‌ ‌legitimate‌ ‌or‌ ‌imitation‌ ‌weapon‌ ‌while‌ ‌in‌ ‌the‌ ‌act‌ ‌of‌ ‌another‌‌ Misdemeanor‌ ‌ ‌ A violation of 9(09). is a Misdemeanor 10 Months

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Transportation‌ ‌of‌ ‌Firearms‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Transport‌ ‌a‌ ‌loaded‌ ‌firearm‌ ‌in‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌vehicle‌ ‌\ i) Exceptions:‌ ‌\ 1) The‌ ‌firearm‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌handgun‌‌ ‌for‌ ‌which‌ ‌the‌ ‌person‌ ‌has‌ ‌a‌ ‌concealed‌ ‌carry‌ ‌permit‌ ‌for‌\ \ A‌ ‌violation‌ ‌of‌ ‌9(10)‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌‌‌ Misdemeanor‌‌ ‌ 5 Months

docs.text: A‌ ‌person‌ ‌commits‌ ‌Transportation‌ ‌of‌ ‌Firearms‌ ‌for‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Purposes‌ ‌when‌ ‌they,‌\ a) Transport‌ ‌‌firearms‌‌ ‌for‌ ‌a‌ ‌legal‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌sale‌ ‌without‌ ‌a‌ ‌Sale‌ ‌permit‌ ‌and‌ ‌a‌ ‌Commercial‌ ‌Firearms‌ ‌transportation‌ ‌Permit‌ ‌\ i) In‌ ‌order‌ ‌for‌ ‌it‌ ‌to‌ ‌be‌ ‌considered‌ ‌a‌ ‌commercial‌ ‌sale,‌ ‌one‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌following‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌true:‌\ 1) The‌ ‌‌firearm‌‌ ‌is‌ ‌registered‌ ‌to‌ ‌a‌ ‌business‌ ‌or‌ ‌gun‌ ‌dealership‌ ‌\ 2) A‌ ‌business‌ ‌funded‌ ‌the‌ ‌purchase‌ ‌of‌ ‌the‌ ‌‌firearms‌‌ ‌the‌ ‌person‌ ‌is‌ ‌now‌ ‌selling.‌ ‌\ 3) The‌ ‌funds‌ ‌made‌ ‌from‌ ‌the‌ ‌sale‌ ‌will‌ ‌go‌ ‌to‌ ‌a‌ ‌business.‌\ b) All‌ ‌‌firearms‌‌ ‌must‌ ‌be‌ ‌unloaded‌ ‌during‌ ‌transport.‌\ \ A violation of 9(11). is a Felony \ \ When‌ ‌transporting‌ ‌your‌ ‌own‌ ‌firearms‌ ‌you‌ ‌are‌ ‌not‌ ‌required‌ ‌to‌ ‌have‌ ‌a‌ ‌permit‌ 17 Months
